title: The Gluten Free Scanner - Celiac healthy diet
description:
Having intolerance to gluten is frustrating enough. The Gluten Free Scanner works simply and fast, using your mobile phone camera to scan the barcodes already found on the products you buy.

We maintain up-to-date the largest database of food and drink products available in the US, to detect the presence of gluten. Over 500,000+ products and growing. A team of registered dietitians, nutritionists and researchers take care of the accuracy of our database.

Every scan will be analyzed on four levels, to provide greater information and protection. This enables you to make a more informed decision as to whether or not to try the product.

Full Version features:

- SEARCH by Product Name, Brand or Category, over 80,000 GLUTEN-FREE products 

- The ‚ÄúDISCOVER GLUTEN FREE‚Äù option is a great way to discover your new gluten free favorites!

- DINING CARD / TRAVEL CARDS, to eat safely in restaurants domestically and abroad

- SEARCHABLE LIST OF SAFE/UNSAFE INGREDIENTS

**** ALSO AVAILABLE FOR IPHONE:

http://scanglutenfree.com

We have plans for new features in the future and always welcome your suggestions.


Note: The Gluten Free Scanner only works in the US. Terms of use: http://scanglutenfree.com/eula

Please take a minute to leave a nice review in the Google Play: it really helps.
comments: Not sure what the people leaving 1-stars are talking about, this app works quite well. I was recently diagnosed with Celiac Disease (can't have gluten), so I'm glad this app exists. I tested it out on some products in my house, and what really impressed me is how lightning FAST it is when scanning and looking up products. Unfortunately there were some products that it didn't have in its database, but this app will certainly come in handy anyway. I hope the database is expanded in the future!

Exactly what I need! I started scanning everything in my fridge and cabinets. The scanner is super fast and accurate. The few things that didn't show up, but most did. I am new to gluten free and this is perfect for me.

I'm glad I only installed the free version. I'm new to avoiding gluten and very few of my foods I have in my house even show up. The suggested or related foods are always some expensive wholefoods brands. I just want an app that can tell me what foods I normally eat are safe and what I need to find alternative gluten free products for. Not very helpful.

This app has been so very helpful when planning meals when my brother-in-law is in town. He has to have all gluten free foods, so I just check everything with this app to be sure he can have it. Don't want him getting sick on my watch !!! Would highly recommend it!! 466eee

Seems to catch only sections of barcode and not the whole thing. It will scan, but miss the last part of the barcode and say that item is not in the database. Edit: thanks to the developer for a quick response! I will try more products

title: Gluten Free Diet Food and Tips
description:
Gluten free diet is very helpful for people with celiac disease, gluten intolerance, gluten sensitivity, wheat allergy and more...
A gluten-free diet is critical for people with celiac disease!

Diet Guide:
1.  What is the Gluten Free Diet? Simple Tips For Going Gluten Free (listen to the audio)
2.  Tips for a gluten-free diet
3.  Starting a Gluten-Free Diet: A Beginner's Guide step by step
4.  Gluten Free Foods List: Why and How You Should Go Gluten Free (listen to the audio)
5.  7-Day Gluten-Free Meal Plan
6.  Gluten Free Recipes: Mexican-style omelette wrap; Ham & egg loaded potato skins and more...
7.  Gluten-free: health fad or life-saving diet?
8.  The Gluten-Free Diet: Facts and Myths
9.  Photo gallery: People before and after doing the diet

Gluten sensitivity can be managed with a gluten free diet.
Here we reveal all you need to know about wheat, and healthy snacking.

title: Find Me Gluten Free
description: The best gluten free restaurant finder out there! Find Me Gluten Free helps you easily eat gluten free. Whether you're celiac, gluten sensitive, or just on a gluten free diet, easily find restaurants, fast food, bars, cafes, grocery stores and more! Easily find dedicated gluten free places with one tap. Search your current location or a specific address. View menus, call, or get directions for each business. View others' ratings and reviews and submit your own.  We're constantly adding businesses, so suggest your favorites. Happy gluten free dining!
descriptionHTML: The best gluten free restaurant finder out there! Find Me Gluten Free helps you easily eat gluten free. Whether you're celiac, gluten sensitive, or just on a gluten free diet, easily find restaurants, fast food, bars, cafes, grocery stores and more! Easily find dedicated gluten free places with one tap. Search your current location or a specific address. View menus, call, or get directions for each business. View others' ratings and reviews and submit your own.  We're constantly adding businesses, so suggest your favorites. Happy gluten free dining!
summary: Helping you live gluten free!
recentChanges: New review format!
comments: This really is a great app. Especially if you are visiting an unknown location. I would give this 5 stars except for one thing: you charge for premium for content that is largely gathered by your customers. I understand the need for the income, but see no compensation for the contributers. I would like to see something like 'free short-term premium for X reviews/additions'.

Awesome app. Have been using for years, and they have the most expansive reviews in even off the main road areas. Have used in other countries and was really helpful in our first trip to Barcelona. Travel in states we have used for first time trips - Chicago, Nashville, Kingsport, road trips between cities, Portland, Oregon Coast, Oahu just as examples.

must have for anyone with celiac disease or gluten sensitivity. I'm not thrilled with the new "premium" features, but I spoke to the developer and understand why he implemented them. and there are a couple ways around using them, if you're cash-strapped like me and don't eat out enough to need them.

It has definitely been useful in some countries, but not in others. Really needs a lot more input from users to be as helpful as possible. Frequently I have to add new places as there are no reviews - and the app fights you tooth and nail when you try to add places. But we will get there! And I would still say it is a "must have" for a traveling celiac.

Every useful feature is now behind a pay wall. Used to have several features I've paid for off and on over the years, now there is absolutely no point to the free version of the app. And the price isn't worth it for questionable crowd sourced information that might be detrimental to your health.

title: Eat! Gluten-Free
description:
You are eating gluten-free, either by doctor's orders or by choice, and you have questions:

‚Ä¢ What is safe to eat?
‚Ä¢ How can I safely prepare gluten-free food?
‚Ä¢ What tastes good?
‚Ä¢ What are the nutrition facts?

Eat! Gluten-Free is the trusted source for all of your gluten-free needs, built and managed by the Celiac Disease Foundation, the nonprofit leader in research, education, and advocacy for celiac disease and non-celiac gluten/wheat sensitivity.

title: Celiac Disease Wheat & Gluten
description:
It is a Free App specially designed for Celiac Disease gluten Sensitivity & wheat allergy Diet and nutrition Tips and awareness in healthy people as well as in Celiac Disease and other similar Digestive Disorder Patients. 

App has following Primary sections:

* Symptoms of Celiac Disease
* How to Diagnose Celiac Disease
* Treatment or Celiac Disease
* Food to Eat
* Food to Avoid
* Common Foods that contain Gluten

Dieting ideas and tips of this app have been carefully reviewed by Experienced and professional dietitians carefully. If you have any medical history or have any additional queries, you can contact dietitian by tapping the Contact button within the App.

If you require additional assistance from real professional dietitians, app allows you to contact the dietician from the App to consult your queries and problems online. You can even seek for your personalized diet chart from the dietitian by using the options from the App.

title: My Food Intolerance List
description:
Do you suffer from lactose, fructose, histamine, gluten, sorbitol or salicylic acid intolerance? Or do you even have several of them? No problem! With ALL i CAN EAT you have all your food intolerances under control.

ALL i CAN EAT adjusts to your individual intolerances and calculates your compatibility for each food. The compatibilities are displayed in a simple traffic light system, ranging from green (very well tolerated) to yellow and orange up to red (bad idea to eat). If a recommendation does not apply to you, you can easily save your individual tolerance for the food concerned.

Search quickly for a specific food, browse certain categories such as beverages, fruits, dairy products, etc. or filter compatibilites by color. In addition, ALL i CAN EAT does also provide many details such as the amounts of lactose, fructose, glucose, histamine, sorbitol, salicylic acid, amines, amino acids, etc. And in case you should miss a food, you can add it easily.

You will never have to search various lists again or learn any numbers by heart! With ALL i CAN EAT you manage all your food intolerances in one place.

title: Gluten-Free Guide
description: The Celiac Disease and Gluten-Free Diet Digital Resource Center is an app designed and maintained by the Celiac Disease Program at Children‚Äôs National Health System to provide a cohesive set of high-quality educational materials to patients and families living with celiac disease or a gluten-related condition. Within this app users have access to a variety of resources to help with living a safe, nutritious, and tasty gluten-free lifestyle including: safe and unsafe ingredient lists, grocery store shopping tips, recipes, nutrition education and cooking videos, a monthly podcast, a news feed of hot topics in the celiac and gluten-free community, and access to continuing education seminars.

title: Gluten Free E
description:
This application is design for people that think about their heath, who want to stay healthy and eat better food!

If you check composition of almost any product you take from a shelf in a store, you'll see, that there are food additives (E numbers). 

A lot of food additives are very harmful for you health, they have high allergy risks and should be avoided. This application will help you to know, which E numbers you should exclude from your daily meals.

You should know that there are food additives that contains gluten and are harmful for your intenstinal!

With help of this application you will be able to check if food additive you see in the composition is safe for you.

A gluten-free diet is one that excludes most grains, and it is recommended for people who have celiac disease or gluten sensitivity. Besides that gluten-free diet is very popular as weight loose diet and some have suggested that a gluten-free diet may help alleviate the signs of autism in children.

Besides that, this application is only 2 MB!

title: Gluten Free Recipes
description:
Gluten is a family of proteins found in wheat, barley, and rye. Glutenin and gliadin are the two primary proteins found in these grains and they play a role in giving gluten-containing foods like dough its elasticity and bread its spongy texture. An ingredient that has been derived from a gluten-containing grain can be labeled as "gluten-free".

A gluten-free diet is the only treatment for the condition. Gluten is found in grains wheat, barley, and rye. On the gluten-free diet, you can eat many foods including meat, fish, fruit, vegetables, rice, and potatoes. You can also eat gluten-free substitute foods and processed foods that don't contain gluten.

A healthy gluten-free diet is no different from an otherwise healthy diet except for the fact that it doesn‚Äôt contain gluten. You should still aim to consume a balance of lean protein, healthy fats, fresh fruits, and nutritious veggies but you‚Äôll need to be careful about which grains you consume. You can still enjoy corn, rice, quinoa, buckwheat, arrowroot, and other ancient grains as well as flours made from nuts and seeds like almond flour and coconut flour. So a gluten-free diet is simply a diet made up of gluten-free foods.

GLUTEN FREE APP EXPERIENCE

This app is simple to navigate and also has multiple tutorials available on how to use the app.
As the recipe is a set of instructions for cooking, our app also provides nutritional information, servings, total time for preparation and recommendations so that nothing can go wrong when you‚Äôre cooking.

Theme Support

Protect your eyes from being hurt by a bright screen at night by enabling dark mode.
Make your Gluten-free cooking experience more comfortable at night.

Smart Shopping List for Gluten-Free Recipes

An organized shopping list allows the user to create ingredients list so you won‚Äôt miss any for the recipe. Users can also add items directly from recipes.
It also has offline access.

Search 1M+ Recipes

descriptionHTML:
Gluten is a family of proteins found in wheat, barley, and rye. Glutenin and gliadin are the two primary proteins found in these grains and they play a role in giving gluten-containing foods like dough its elasticity and bread its spongy texture. An ingredient that has been derived from a gluten-containing grain can be labeled as "gluten-free".

A gluten-free diet is the only treatment for the condition. Gluten is found in grains wheat, barley, and rye. On the gluten-free diet, you can eat many foods including meat, fish, fruit, vegetables, rice, and potatoes. You can also eat gluten-free substitute foods and processed foods that don't contain gluten.

A healthy gluten-free diet is no different from an otherwise healthy diet except for the fact that it doesn‚Äôt contain gluten. You should still aim to consume a balance of lean protein, healthy fats, fresh fruits, and nutritious veggies but you‚Äôll need to be careful about which grains you consume. You can still enjoy corn, rice, quinoa, buckwheat, arrowroot, and other ancient grains as well as flours made from nuts and seeds like almond flour and coconut flour. So a gluten-free diet is simply a diet made up of gluten-free foods.

GLUTEN FREE APP EXPERIENCE

This app is simple to navigate and also has multiple tutorials available on how to use the app.
As the recipe is a set of instructions for cooking, our app also provides nutritional information, servings, total time for preparation and recommendations so that nothing can go wrong when you‚Äôre cooking.

Theme Support

Protect your eyes from being hurt by a bright screen at night by enabling dark mode.
Make your Gluten-free cooking experience more comfortable at night.

Smart Shopping List for Gluten-Free Recipes

An organized shopping list allows the user to create ingredients list so you won‚Äôt miss any for the recipe. Users can also add items directly from recipes.
It also has offline access.

where you can find the recipes you looking for or discover new recipes

Native Language

Another key feature of our app is it supports multiple languages.

title: Gluten Free Diet Guide
description:
The Gluten Free diet is a fast growing restriction diet somewhat similar to the Paleo diet. However, the Gluten Free Diet is more than just a 'fad' diet and has been medically recommended for those with Celiac Disease and Gluten Sensitivity. 

The diet excludes all forms of wheat and gluten ingredients. This can provide improved digestion, mental health, reduced inflammation, increased energy levels, and possible weight loss in those with Celiac Disease and Gluten Sensitivity. 

This is a NO-BS guide to the Gluten Free Diet. Other guides have poor quality information and terrible grammar. We personally researched all of the most accurate and scientific info, and collected it in this App.

The Gluten Free Diet Guide covers:
-1000s of gluten free recipes
-The Basics: What is Gluten, Celiac Disease, Non-Celiac Gluten Sensitivity, and Wheat Allergy
-The Benefits
-Dangers and Side-Effects of the Diet (yes, eliminating Wheat/Grains can have some consequences)
-Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
-How to Get Started
-Food List: What's Allowed
-Food List: What to Avoid
-Tips For Staying Gluten Free
-Recipe Links

Let us know what you would like to see added, Thanks!

title: Gluten Free Recipes - Easy Gluten Free Diet Ideas
description:
Gluten free recipes to stay healthy. Gluten free diet is a type of diet that omits all gluten containing food. Gluten is present in foods like wheat, rye, triticale, barley, malt, and their by-products. 


People suffering from celiac disease are often prescribed with a Gluten free diet. Celiac disease is a hereditary auto-immune condition in which the finger-like nutrient absorptive surface of the small intestine called ‚Äúvilli‚Äù becomes inflamed or damaged which can hinder nutrient absorption; hence, leading to malnutrition. Common symptoms of Celiac disease are bloating, abdominal pain, diarrhea, vomiting, and constipation. By omitting gluten from the diet, the patient can improve nutrient absorption and inhibit further complications. 


Some people find it difficult to adjust to a gluten free diet that is why patience and proper meal planning is a must. This recipe app lets you discover many alternatives that will allow you to still enjoy your favorite foods but without the gluten. 


Navigating recipes using this app is very easy. It will show you different categories like Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner, Snack, and Dessert. You can select your gluten free recipes by simply tapping on the photo.


To guide you in terms of Nutrition, this recipe app comes with a Nutritional Information. You can see it towards the end of each recipe, this feature is beneficial for people who are aiming to some lose weight or maintain healthy body weight.


This cool app also features a shopping list wherein you can choose the ingredients that you need to buy and then you can view all at once it in the Shopping List section of the app. 


Lastly, you can enjoy your favorite gluten free recipes anytime, because once installed on your Android device you don‚Äôt need to stay connected to the internet to access them.


Get started by DOWNLOADING Gluten Free Recipes - Easy Gluten Free Diet Ideas app NOW!

title: Infood - Ingredients food scanner
description:
Do you know what‚Äôs in your food?
Are you a vegan or vegetarian? Do you eat lactose free, gluten free or look for a clean label or just trans fat free.

Infood app will help you decide if a given food is suitable for you or not, based on your personal preferences.
Reading labels all the time may be annoying and exhausting, let us do it for you.

Follow us on Facebook, share your experience and feature requests:
https://www.facebook.com/infoodapp.net or emails us at info@infoodapp.net
You can also visit our website https://infoodapp.net/

You can choose among our premium filters: Vegan, Vegetarian, Clean Label, Lactose free Gluten free and Trans fat. You can combine them with specific ingredients that you would like to avoid.
Just scan the product's barcode and Infood app will let you know if any of the ingredients you configured is found on the label.

If a product is not found in our database you can easily add it.
Just take a picture of the ingredients, Infood app will automatically extract the ingredients from the picture. Always check and correct the ingredients text.

You can add ingredients in many languages, Infood app will detect the language.
For travelers who want to know what they eat, In food will translate the ingredients in food.

If possible always add ingredients in English. This will help us provide you with more accurate results.
The app is flexible and may be used to scan foods if you have allergies or food intolerance (Gluten free, Lactose free), for healthy eating (Clean label, Trans fat), when following different diets like Vegan or Vegetarian.

Our new Vegan ingredients scanner, Vegetarian ingredients scanner, Gluten free ingredients scanner, Lactose free ingredients scanner, Trans fat ingredients scanner and Clean label ingredients scanner will be soon extended to include more diets and lifestyles.
We strongly stay behind the clean food idea, our Clean label food scanner is a must for healthy eating.
You can choose also trans fat free eating, sugar free foods, no preservatives, no colorants, no E numbers, no food additives and many other combinations

title: Gluten free food checker
description:
Living gluten free can be a challenge but we‚Äôve made it easy for you with our Gluten Free Food Checker app. Winner of the MemCom 2019 award for Best Use of an App.  

Search thousands of food products suitable for your gluten free diet and build your profile so we can show you foods that suit your other dietary needs too. You can enhance your food preferences profile by choosing from 14 allergen options so our app will find suitable products for your diet, no matter what you‚Äôre avoiding. What‚Äôs more all of our licensed Crossed Grain products are clearly marked with our renowned Crossed Grain symbol, making it even easier to help you identify the right foods for you.

The app is only available to Coeliac UK members and is included in the current membership fee. The app allows you to:

	‚Ä¢	access a searchable directory listing over 150,000 products suitable for a gluten free diet 
	‚Ä¢	handy barcode scanner to make shopping easier 
	‚Ä¢	search by ingredients
	‚Ä¢	view full product ingredient and nutritional information
	‚Ä¢	view ready made product lists
	‚Ä¢	create personalised shopping lists
	‚Ä¢	use our labelling video to help choose food from the mainstream supermarket aisles.

Not a member of Coeliac UK?  Want to download the app and learn more about how our exclusive member resources can help you live well gluten free? Take a look at www.coeliac.org.uk/join-us/membership/ 


Information about Coeliac UK and how to contact us

Coeliac UK is the charity for people who need to live without gluten. We provide independent trustworthy advice and support, strive for better gluten free food in more places, and fund crucial research to manage the impact of gluten and find answers to coeliac disease. And, we do it all so that one day, no one‚Äôs life will be limited by gluten.

Helpline: 0333 332 2033

GeneralEnquiries@coeliac.org.uk

title: Dedicated Gluten Free
description:
Trying to find all the dedicated gluten free restaurants around the world? Wondering how to travel with celiac disease? If you've ever asked yourself "Where are all the gluten free restaurants near me?" Then this app is going to be your new best friend! With this one of a kind app you will be able to find all the gluten free bakeries, restaurants, food trucks, breweries, and more with the click of a button.

Full of all the restaurants with gluten free menus (because every single place is gluten-free!), gluten free pizzeria, gluten free bakeries, gluten free ice cream shops, and more, you will never ever worry about eating out again on your gluten-free diet.

This dedicated gluten free restaurant app is literally my heart and soul poured into a project. It all started back in my apartment in Korea in late 2017 with a muddled dream but a huge vision of where I could help celiacs travel the world safely. I saw a gap in the market for a directory of all the dedicated gluten free bakeries, restaurants, and more and knew I wanted to help.

And not only help gluten free travelers and gluten free folks around the world, but interview the entrepreneurs that opened 100 percent gluten free restaurants, and support the entrepreneurs that help us eat safely!

Features:
-Find all the dedicated gluten free restaurants, bakeries, breweries, cafes, food trucks and more with the click of a button

-Full map feature where you can see each dedicated gluten free location on a larger map so that you can easily plan out your gluten free eating and traveling! (the ability to click through to each restaurant is coming very soon!)

-Gluten free locations closest to you are shown first

-Call, click on the website, and get directions to each location directly from the app

-See feature photos of locations to know where you are headed before going

-Add dedicated gluten free locations that are not already in the app

-Videos from select restaurants


User specific features:
-Ability to create an account and save your "favorites" to a favorite section that customizes your user experience within the app

-Save your favorites easily with a "heart"


Upcoming features to be released soon:
-Connect with other gluten free travelers in real time

-Ability to edit locations that have changed or closed in real time

-Features of 100% gluten free restaurant owners

-Upgrade your dedicated gluten free listing if you are a dedicated gluten free facility

-Click through from the map directly to dedicated gluten free locations

-Gluten free locations closest to you are shown first

-Call, click on the website, and get directions to each location directly from the app

-See feature photos of locations to know where you are headed before going

-Add dedicated gluten free locations that are not already in the app

-Videos from select restaurants


User specific features:
-Ability to create an account and save your "favorites" to a favorite section that customizes your user experience within the app

-Save your favorites easily with a "heart"


Upcoming features to be released soon:
-Connect with other gluten free travelers in real time

-Ability to edit locations that have changed or closed in real time

-Features of 100% gluten free restaurant owners

-Upgrade your dedicated gluten free listing if you are a dedicated gluten free facility

-Click through from the map directly to dedicated gluten free locations
summary: Eat 100% gluten free. Every single spot is dedicated gluten-free and celiac safe
recentChanges:
What's NEW in Version 1.5 on the 4th screen of the app:
-Submit a change to a dedicated gluten free location directly from the app
-Contact us directly from the app
-Leave a 5 star review on the App Store directly from the app
-Click through to For Gluten Sake from the app
-Connect on social media from the app (Instagram and Facebook)
comments: Having Celiac Disease a dedicated kitchen is a must when traveling. Unfortunately there aren't many dedicated gluten free kitchens but because of this app I was able to plan a getaway to have my safe birthday meals without having to spend so much time trying to read every location that comes up with the word gluten free. I still confirm with the that they are a dedicated kitchen before going, so far no issues. The map is a great feature.

App has potential. At the present moment it does not locate anything at all, not even big cities like Philadelphia which have a ton of GF establishments and/or offerings. The first day I used it a few months back it introduced me to a bakery that was new too me. Aside from that, nothing! Hope you figure out how to remedy the glitches, best of luck!

Location Services REQUIRED. Why can't I bypass that and input in a zip code or town and state? It's foolish to assume I want to find places where I currently am every time I open the app. You wait for the app to load and can't change the search location. So much for planning out restaurants before traveling.

It is so wonderful to be able to find safe places to eat with this app! Richmond, VA doesn't have many options, but I now know of 3 new places that I had no clue about. This will definitely make my next traveling experience much much safer and less anxiety-ridden.

I love this app! I found some great new places to eat close to home. I also travel a lot and this has been very helpful. It's so nice to get to try new places and not have to go to the old standbys when I'm on the road.

title: Gluten Dude: Got Celiac? Live a Better Life.
description:
The purpose of my app is simple: to better the lives of those living with celiac disease and anyone else who must eat gluten-free; to create a close-knit community where people in the gluten-free community come to discover, to learn, to share, and to connect, all to make their lives easier and healthier.

Living a 100% gluten-free life certainly has it challenges: physically, mentally and socially. Using the Gluten Dude app will help alleviate those challenges.

CHALLENGE: EATING OUT SAFELY
Eating out is one of the more stressful parts of having celiac disease. One crumb is all it takes to set off the autoimmune response. Everything that is fun and spontaneous about eating out can be overshadowed by the anxiety of whether you can get through your meal unscathed.

Solution: A directory of only 100% gluten-free restaurants, guaranteeing you a safe meal. Each restaurant includes images, a description, reviews, ratings, directions, etc. The app currently covers the US, Canada, Paris, Italy, London, Spain, Germany, Hong Kong, New Zealand and Australia, with more locations coming. 

Note: Recommended but Non-100% GF restaurants are now included on the app as well but are clearly delineated. These restaurants are personally vetted before being added to the app. NEW RESTAURANTS ADDED EVERY DAY!

CHALLENGE: GETTING BAD/WRONG ADVICE
The internet is littered with falsehoods and dangerous information regarding celiac disease. People are looking for answers to their problems, quickly and accurately, and they are not sure where to turn or who to trust, putting their health in jeopardy.

Solution: A forum where fear mongering and misinformation will be strongly discouraged. Varying opinions? Absolutely. But no "McDonalds French Fries are gluten free" kind of stuff. There are a number of topics where you‚Äôll be able to chime in with questions, answers and advice. The forum includes Ask the Community, Ask Gluten Dude, Share Your Celiac Story, and more.

You also have access to videos from yours truly (Gluten Dude), where I answer reader emails, throw out some celiac rants and talk about the world of celiac disease.

CHALLENGE: ISOLATION
Celiac disease is a very misunderstood disease and can be quite isolating. I've received so many emails over the years from people whose own friends and family don't take their disease seriously; who don't get invited out to eat because they're "too difficult"; who are bullied at school simply because they can't eat gluten. And most of the time, there is no one there to turn to, to listen to you, to understand you.

SOLUTION: Live chat. This app will connect you with others in the celiac/GF community, allowing one on one private chats. You‚Äôll even have the option of providing your zip code, allowing people to search for others by location.

CHALLENGE: FINDING GLUTEN-FREE BEER
Beer, sadly, is not gluten-free. The most popular "gluten-free" beers on the market today are actually "gluten-removed" and are not safe to drink. There are a handful of amazing 100% gluten-free beers out there, but they can be difficult to find.

Solution: The Gluten Dude app shows the stores, bars and restaurants where people can purchase gluten-free beer. The user will be able to search by any location and each location will show which specific gluten-free beers each establishment carries. Cheers!

AND LASTLY...WHO THE HECK IS GLUTEN DUDE?
My real name is Scott but within the celiac and gluten-free communities, I'm known as Gluten Dude, a popular, passionate and outspoken celiac disease advocate. I was diagnosed with celiac disease in 2008 and I launched my blog in 2011. Here are a few kudos from my fellow celiacs:

"Thank you from the bottom of my heart. You changed the journey for me." - Joyful

"You make me smile, you make me cry, and you make me mad. But most of all, you make me grateful that I don‚Äôt have to figure this all out on my own." - Darlena

"Your latest post is why my son wants to be Gluten Dude when he grows up." - Denise

recentChanges:
- Bug Fixes and Improvement.

- New Dashboard View.
- New ui for Let's Discuss Section.

comments: Just downloaded the app, so really just starting to see what information is available. I live in a more rural area of my state, so many of the current restaurant references I'm seeing are well out of my area. I also recognize that it takes a village and that over time more information will come online as others join, the community grows and the app evolves. I like what I'm seeing so far, and look forward to learning more from the app.
Easy to navigate and fast

Someone who must eat gluten free should download this app. Not only is it a directory of safe places to eat, it is a community-based app where you can connect with others. This is like a portable toolbox for the GF community.

title: Gluten Free Scanner, gluten free or not
description:
This app will allow you to know if a specific product/food is gluten free or not.
It allows you to search by name or scan a barcode and find out if the product/food is gluten free or not
Used by people with Celiac

recentChanges: Bug fixes
comments: It won't start up. Just states "looking for update. Please wait" nothing happens.
I cant even give this one star, as its been stuck on looking for updates! Unfortunately i am forced to give at least one star!

This app just stays on the "checking for updates" page and will not budge. I finally ran out of patience and uninstalled it. I highly recommend finding another app. Which is what I plan to do immediately.
It wouldn't open it just says its looking for an update. I downloaded it several times. Each time its the same thing.

Once i discovered that I hace celiac disease i was so concerned as even a little amount of it could trigger the issue. Only when i found this app i feel so relieved. Once my friend told me that there is an app for everything in this age and it turned out to be true. I couldn't thank the people who made this app.

title: mySymptoms Food Diary & Symptom Tracker (Lite)
description:
Record, track, and analyze your food, mood, and symptoms to gain insights into your digestive health. 

mySymptoms makes logging a food and symptom diary easy - remembering your favorite foods and providing customizable symptoms. The diary analysis reveals any patterns that emerge between your diet and symptoms. Print a PDF (Android 4.4 or above) / web report of your diary/journal.


DIARY / JOURNAL

‚Ä¢ Record food, drink, medication, stress, exercise, environmental factors, and other activities and notes 
‚Ä¢ Record any symptoms you experience (including intensity, duration, and notes) 
‚Ä¢ Record your energy, sleep quality, and bowel movements (using Bristol scale)
‚Ä¢ View and modify your diary entries 
‚Ä¢ Create and modify your own symptoms 
‚Ä¢ Export your food diary as a PDF (Android 4.4 or above), CSV, or Web report for printing or sharing


INSIGHTS

‚Ä¢ Discover any patterns between your diet and symptoms
‚Ä¢ View suspect foods, trends, and correlations between food and symptoms
‚Ä¢ Configurable analysis


ORGANIZER 

‚Ä¢ Add or modify your own drinks, foods, medications, exercises, and other activities 
‚Ä¢ Add or modify meals with your own ingredients 
‚Ä¢ Add or modify detailed ingredients to any item ‚Äì food, drink or medication 


HOW TO USE

‚Ä¢ Simply begin by tracking your meals along with any symptoms you experience
‚Ä¢ Over time, the more you track, the more the analysis algorithms have to work with to provide any insights


mySymptoms is used by sufferers of:

‚Ä¢ IBS (Irritable Bowel Syndrome)
‚Ä¢ IBD (Inflammatory Bowel Disease)
‚Ä¢ Food intolerance and sensitivities such as dairy, gluten, lactose
‚Ä¢ Acid reflux
‚Ä¢ Crohn‚Äôs disease
‚Ä¢ Celiac disease
‚Ä¢ SIBO (Small Intestinal Bacterial Overgrowth)
‚Ä¢ Ulcerative colitis
‚Ä¢ Migraines & cluster headaches
‚Ä¢ Eczema
‚Ä¢ Bloating, heartburn, and many other digestive conditions 

mySymptoms is also useful for recording a FODMAP diet.


Please note that the analysis algorithms use statistical methods to identify suspect foods/items and do not understand your diet or specific health circumstances. 


The information provided by this app is not medical advice. Always consult a doctor if you have any concerns about your health. Always consult a licensed health professional prior to modifying your diet.


GO PREMIUM

‚Ä¢ Advanced analysis including ingredients and food groups (where provided)
‚Ä¢ Detailed results for each item includes more specific information, a histogram and trend chart 
‚Ä¢ Review events a food or symptom appears in
‚Ä¢ No adverts


mySymptoms also provides a list of common symptoms for food intolerance, IBS, IBD and Crohn's, but you can add extra symptoms as required.


Terms: http://mysymptoms.net/terms


NOTE: mySymptoms Food Diary currently supports portrait orientation only.


SUPPORT

If you experience any issues with mySymptoms, then please contact our support team - we will do our utmost to resolve the issue as soon as possible. Thanks!

support@skygazerlabs.com

MORE INFORMATION

Web: www.mysymptoms.net
Twitter: twitter.com/mysymptoms
Facebook: fb.me/mySymptoms
Enquiries: hello@mysymptoms.net

recentChanges: + Fix for file export on Android 10
comments: I just downloaded this app but I already love it! I love that it doesn't count calories and focuses on the way food makes you feel instead. I'm also loving every other category that you can track, like energy level, medication, environment, and mood. This is going to be so helpful with managing my chronic illness! Thank you to the developer! If I continue to use it I am for sure buying premium!

Paid premium, and didn't recieve. Sending questions and suggestions via email, and Facebook. No answer because they are closed on weekends. This is a useful app, for people suffering from gut issues caused by foods. They really need to add nutrition info to the diary because those with gastroparesis need to eat less fiber and not more. I have not found an app where the amount of fiber is customizable. And for this app, it would be appropriate.

Really good set up, easy to use. I like it a lot. I can log any food ingredients that I eat, the time and date, my mood at the time, and any symptoms I get, and much more. A very good diary to log my food and drink intake.

Once you've got your regular entries in its really quick to use. I like the range of options available. Mealtimes, exercise, mood, environment, sleep etc. Finding it really useful, plus I can send a report to my GP. üòä
This is the best app I could have found to help me focus on my eating and health. I like the flexibility of being able to write notes for entries and to add symptoms. I highly recommend to others.

title: Coeliac Map (Gluten Free)
description:
A map of Coeliac (gluten free) food reviews and ratings mainly the UK, but also for other places around the world.

If you can't eat wheat or gluten and you're out and about and need to find somewhere to eat, the Coeliac Map is here to help. Features user-submitted reviews of Coeliac friendly venues around the UK and further afield.

If you know of somewhere great, or somewhere to avoid, please please submit it to the map, either using the android app, or on the website. Share the knowledge you have to help other Coeliacs.

comments: Can't add places that you know are gluten free. If you live in an area that this app doesn't cover, extremely limited in what it can do.
Not a single marker loading up?!
As an example the venues listed near  me are completely out of date. One has been a Sainsbury's for years. I would delete them if I knew how. The only place I eat regularly Isn't even in.

Its need more different dinner n foods.....why load of stuff pizza, need Chinese and Indians gfree hmmmm	I know ppl bit fed up with its who are having gfree n difficult find where are..... I am baking own all of the times.

I''ve only had it a short while, but looks really good. Only thing lots of places I know from local area that are gf are missing, so maybe a method for user to suggest new places to add to the map would be a good addition.

title: Is It Gluten Free?
description:
This app will help you to choose Gluten free products and drinks in any shop. Find all the possible products allowed from the point of view of GF dietary laws.

Just enter the name of the product and press Search, app will scan Gluten free authorities databases for the certifications details.

Special thanks to Karina Krasovicka (http://Arbooz.lv) and Irina Rubinchik (the Latvian Celiac Society ‚ÄúLife Without Gluten‚Äù http://dzivebezglutena.lv/) for support and help.
        
NOTE: ALL INFORMATION IS TAKEN FROM THE UPPER MENTIONED LIST OF AUTHORITIES AS IS. PLEASE DO NOT RATE THE CONTENT, AS SOON AS I PROVIDE ONLY SEARCHING ENGINE.
IF YOU CANNOT FIND SOMETHING, CONTACT PROPER AUTHORITY FOR IMPROVEMENTS.

tags:gluten free, celiac
descriptionHTML:
This app will help you to choose Gluten free products and drinks in any shop. Find all the possible products allowed from the point of view of GF dietary laws.

Just enter the name of the product and press Search, app will scan Gluten free authorities databases for the certifications details.

Special thanks to Karina Krasovicka (http://Arbooz.lv) and Irina Rubinchik (the Latvian Celiac Society ‚ÄúLife Without Gluten‚Äù http://dzivebezglutena.lv/) for support and help.

NOTE: ALL INFORMATION IS TAKEN FROM THE UPPER MENTIONED LIST OF AUTHORITIES AS IS. PLEASE DO NOT RATE THE CONTENT, AS SOON AS I PROVIDE ONLY SEARCHING ENGINE.
IF YOU CANNOT FIND SOMETHING, CONTACT PROPER AUTHORITY FOR IMPROVEMENTS.

title: Celicidad. Comer sin gluten
description:
Celicidad App es una app gratuita que te permite localizar m√°s de 1.900 restaurantes con opciones sin gluten en Espa√±a. La aplicaci√≥n recoge la localizaci√≥n de cada uno de ellos, sus datos b√°sicos (direcci√≥n, tel√©fono, web‚Ä¶), as√≠ como otro tipo de especificaciones interesantes para el p√∫blico celiaco, como es el tipo de comida, el ranking de precios, si tienen pan, si tienen cerveza, carta sin gluten, postres o si han recibido formaci√≥n por parte de alguna de las asociaciones de celiacos que trabajan en Espa√±a.
 
De esta manera, y gracias  a Celicidad App, los celiacos pueden salir a comer de casa con tranquilidad, conociendo nuevos lugares y disfrutando sin riesgo de contaminaci√≥n. Adem√°s la ficha de cada restaurante incluye im√°genes sobre los platos m√°s representativos del establecimiento y permite a los usuarios registrados (registro gratuito), valorar y comentar sobre su experiencia en el restaurante. 

Una de las funcionalidades m√°s √∫tiles de la App es que realiza b√∫squedas en funci√≥n de la ubicaci√≥n del usuario, as√≠ podr√° saber qu√© opciones sin gluten tiene m√°s cerca de donde se encuentra. Tambi√©n tiene la opci√≥n navegaci√≥n vinculada al GPS del m√≥vil, con lo que s√≥lo tiene que seleccionar el restaurante sin gluten al que quiere ir, y el sistema de navegaci√≥n le guiar√° hasta llegar a su destino. 

El equipo de Celicidad, formador por un gran n√∫mero de celiacos, actualiza la App semanalmente, con lo que la cifra de restaurantes sin gluten aumenta a medida que va pasando el tiempo. Pero Celicidad es mucho m√°s que una app, es un entorno especializado en celiaqu√≠a, dieta sin gluten y restauraci√≥n sin gluten. Todas sus informaciones y sus proyectos se pueden encontrar en www.celicidad.net. 

Dieta Sin Gluten

La celiaqu√≠a es una enfermedad cr√≥nica, autoinmune y multisist√©mica provocada por la intolerancia al gluten. Se da en individuos con predisposici√≥n gen√©tica cuyo sistema inmune reacciona al recibir gluten. El gluten es una prote√≠na presente en cereales como el trigo, la cebada, el centeno y sus derivados. La avena se considera tambi√©n un cereal con gluten a pesar de que de forma natural no lo lleva, pero suele llegar al mercado contaminado. El √∫nico tratamiento para la celiaqu√≠a es una dieta sin gluten estricta y de por vida, y esto implica renunciar a todos aquellos alimentos que llevan gluten o han sido contaminados con gluten durante su proceso de elaboraci√≥n. Salir a comer fuera de casa, es por tanto, una actividad que entra√±a cierto riesgo debido al desconocimiento por parte del sector de la restauraci√≥n de la dieta sin gluten. Adem√°s de cocinar sin gluten y cocinar la celiaqu√≠a, los restauradores deben ser capaces de garantizar la ausencia total de contaminaci√≥n cruzada a la hora de preparar los platos sin gluten.

title: My Gluten Free Recipes
description:
My Gluten Free Recipes is a totally free app that provides a selection of the best and the Healthiest Gluten-Free Recipes available around the web for the people suffering Coeliac Disease or Gluten Intolerance who follows a Gluten-Free Diet .

Gluten is a general name for proteins found in wheat and rye that helps foods maintain their shape, acting as a glue that holds food together. Gluten can be found in many types of foods, even ones that would not be expected.

This app gives you access to Hundreds of Gluten-Free Recipes that are going to be updated on monthly basis . The Recipes are broken into 7 Categories :  

Breakfast & Brunch  
Appetizers  
Bread  
Main Dishes 
Side Dishes
Desserts 

And a special menu for Favorite Recipes where you can find all your preferred Gluten-Free Dishes .

On every recipe you gonna find detailed preparation instructions and informations like Time , Servings , and Calories ..

You can make you Shopping List from the ingredients and send it via your social apps .

Enjoy Cooking and Stay Healthy :) !

title: FODMAP Helper - Diet Companion
description:
FODMAP Helper - Diet Companion
This app makes identification of high and low FODMAP foods easier to help you with your FODMAP friendly diet. This can be helpful in reducing symptoms for people with IBS, Irritable Bowel Syndrome, Crohn's disease, Colitis, Lactose Intolerance and various other food intolerances, food sensitivities, and stomach problems.

Features include:
- Comprehensive list of foods and whether or not they are low FODMAP foods, to make finding foods that won't exacerbate your IBS easier.
- Search by food name and category.
- General FODMAP Diet and Irritable Bowel Syndrome, IBS, Crohn's disease, Colitis, and - 
- Lactose Intolerence and other food sensitivities info.
- Additional details on the specific breakdowns of each food and whether it is high, medium, or low in the main categories of Polyols, Oligos, Fructose, and Lactose.


Premium Features Include:
My Experience - Log your personal experience with foods to determine if a food works for you regardless of its FODMAP content. Rate whether you had a good or bad reaction to a food after eating it, then leave detailed notes so that you know for next time how said food will affect you.

Community Experience - See how the community has reacted to a food via anonymized My Experience ratings. This will let you know if the majority of users of the app had a good or bad reaction to a food.

My Experience and Community Experience data analysis - Advanced graphs and data analysis present the my experience and community experience data to you in a useful and intuitive format to show you breakdowns of good and bad reactions to the various food categories as well as what your worst foods are.

Challenge - The FODMAP Diet is an elimination diet for IBS, GI diseases, and food sensitivities. Once you've eliminated all high FODMAP foods from your diet, you can challenge foods to determine if they work for you. This lets you introduce these foods back into your regular meals one at a time and track your experience with each food after three days to determine if it will work in your FODMAP friendly diet. More details on challenges are contained within the app.

About FODMAPs and IBS
FODMAPs are short chain carbohydrates that are poorly absorbed in the small intestine, especially for people with Irritable Bowel Syndrome, IBS, Crohn's disease, Colitis, Lactose Intolerance, Gluten Intolerance, other food intolerances and stomach sensitivities. They include short chain oligo-saccharide polymers of fructose and galactooligosaccharides, disaccharides (lactose), monosaccharides (fructose), and sugar alcohols (polyols).

The term is an acronym, derived from:

*Fermentable
*Oligo-
*Di-
*Mono-saccharides
*And
*Polyols 

Although these specific carbs are naturally present in the foods we eat, diet restriction has been found to improve symptom control in people with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) and other functional gastrointestinal disorders (FGID), such as Lactose Intolerance, Gluten Intolerance, Crohn's disease, Colitis, and other stomach sensitivities. Prior to the formation of the FODMAP concept, diet was seldom used as first line therapy for management of IBS, Crohn's, Colitis, Lactose intolerance and other FGID.

Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) is a group of symptoms‚Äîincluding abdominal pain and changes in bowel movement patterns without evidence of underlying damage. The main symptoms of IBS are abdominal pain, discomfort in association with frequent diarrhea or constipation and a change in bowel habits.


DISCLAIMER:
We do not perform any testing ourselves. All compiled data should be used as guidelines not as basis of fact. Consult your physician before beginning any new diet. This general information is not intended to diagnose any medical condition or to replace the advice of your healthcare professional.

comments: It would be nice if it included more for free but the search option is really handy and seems very accurate!

Premium features cost more than the Apple App store version... Shouldn't that be the opposite? But let's be serious for what this app offers which is just to give info from a list already done Monash FODMAP. Even the Monash FODMAP app is reasonably price.

Much easier to use and the big printed list I had. Well done.
An excellent app it offers quality information quickly.

title: Gluten Free Diet
description: """Resting easy   After determination of coeliac sickness, recuperating and to what extent it takes to feel better on a gluten free eating regimen can differ.   A few people feel altogether better inside a couple of days of beginning a gluten free eating routine yet a few people may see to a greater extent a continuous change in their indications or that one manifestation enhances before another.   It can take between a half year and up to five years (at times longer) for the gut harm caused by eating gluten to completely mend. A few components are believed to be engaged with the variable time taken for the gut to mend, including age and seriousness of gut harm at analysis.   On the off chance that your side effects have not enhanced or have turned out to be more regrettable since beginning a gluten free eating regimen, address your GP, dietitian as well as gastroenterologist who are best put to screen your reaction to the gluten free eating regimen.   In the event that you commit an error   Following a gluten free eating routine is a learning procedure, for you as well as for your family and companions. Missteps can happen while you're following a gluten free eating regimen, particularly on the off chance that you have just as of late been analyzed.   On the off chance that you have coeliac sickness and eat gluten by botch, you would as a rule begin side effects a couple of hours subsequent to eating it and the manifestations can last from a couple of hours to a few days. Be that as it may, the impacts fluctuate from individual to individual, and rely upon how much gluten you've eaten, how touchy you are and to what extent you have been on a gluten free eating regimen.   On the off chance that you have coeliac infection, eating gluten harms your gut. On the off chance that you commit the intermittent error and eat gluten coincidentally, it's probably not going to cause enduring gut harm."""

title: Intol ‚Äî Scans food intolerances
description:
New: Intol Version 3
Developed from scratch with additional features: Get Intol 3

You put one product after another back on the shelf because you can't tolerate it?
You now know that the intolerable ingredient is hidden at the back of the table of contents, but do you still sometimes catch one?

That won't happen to you in the future, with Intol!

Intol scans lists of ingredients and immediately recognizes what you do not tolerate.

Whether at home or directly in the supermarket: 
Simply hold the camera of your smartphone on the content of the packaging. The ingredients are marked in color:

Red ~ not tolerable
Orange ~ poorly tolerable
Yellow ~ moderately tolerable

A green "OK" means that you can tolerate it. Scanned, checked!

The following intolerances are supported:

- Lactose intolerance
- Histamine intolerance
- Fructose intolerance
- Gluten intolerance (Coeliac disease)
- Sorbitol intolerance
- Salicylic acid intolerance
- Glutamate intolerance
- Special nutrition during pregnancy

Intol also helps you during pregnancy!
When you're pregnant, special rules apply. Intol helps you to recognize those foods in the jungle that you should avoid during this time.

With the new Ingredients search function you can search for specific ingredients.


Required permissions
- Camera access to scan the ingredients list
- Vibration to give feedback on detected incompatible ingredients
- Accessing the external memory to save settings

Intol is ad-free and works without mobile data, Wi-Fi or user tracking.


Keywords: histamine, lactose, lactose-free app, fructose, gluten-free app, celiac disease app, sorbitol, salicylic, incompatibility, intolerance, food intolerance, allergy, pregnant food, glutamate

title: Food Intolerance
description:
This App helps people with FOOD REACTIONS to make food lists based on their sensitivities.
View details, Filter, Sort and Favorite according to your own sensitivities and preferences.
‚úîFOOD REACTIONS included:
‚Ä¢	Histamine Intolerance
‚Ä¢	Lactose Intolerance
‚Ä¢	Dairy Intolerance
‚Ä¢	Gluten Intolerance
‚Ä¢	Celiac Disease
‚Ä¢	Mast Cell Activation
‚Ä¢	Salicylate Sensitivity
‚Ä¢	Allergy
‚úî CATEGORIES included:
‚Ä¢	Medicines
‚Ä¢	Probiotics & bacteria
‚Ä¢	Vegetables
‚Ä¢	Fruit
‚Ä¢	Nuts & Seeds
‚Ä¢	Seafood
‚Ä¢	Meat
‚Ä¢	Egg
‚Ä¢	Dairy
‚Ä¢	Legumes
‚Ä¢	Cereals
‚Ä¢	Drinks
‚Ä¢	Alcoholic drinks
‚Ä¢	Sugar & Sweets
‚Ä¢	Condiments (spices, herbs, sauces)
‚Ä¢	Natural extracts
‚Ä¢	Fragrances
‚Ä¢	Food additives
‚Ä¢	Physical Triggers

‚úîFILTERING of categories is useful for people who follow DIETS such as:
‚Ä¢	Ovo/lacto/vegetarian/vegan
‚Ä¢	Paleolithic

‚úîPROPERTIES included (when data available):
‚Ä¢	Concentrations of histamine, biogenic amines, salicylates and nitrates
‚Ä¢	Mast cell degranulators and allergens
‚Ä¢	Inhibitors of histamine degrading enzymes (DAO, HNMT)
‚Ä¢	Containing gluten, lectins, lactose

‚úîSORTING of foods according to these properties is useful when you know your sensitivities or when you want to find out your sensitivities.
‚úîLANGUAGES: English, German, Dutch.
! DISCLAIMER: Consult a health professional before taking health related actions.

title: Food Allergy Scanner
description:
Welcome to the Food Allergy Scanner! 

This app allows you to identify your allergens in products by scanning their barcode. You can create personalized plans to accommodate various food allergies, as well as other food-related limitations, such as Celiac Disease and Lactose Intolerance. Scan the barcode of a product, and the Food Allergy Scanner will help you determine whether it fits within your food limitations.

By scanning the barcodes of products in grocery stores, you can access relevant information about what you can and cannot eat. 

With the Food Allergy Scanner, you can:
- Identify your allergens
- Scan the barcodes of products
- Receive relevant information about what you can and cannot eat
- Easily accommodate for your food allergies and/or food-related limitations


Information is available on over 800,000 products, including almost 200,000 US products. We use ingredients published by the non-profit organization  Open Food Facts   available under the  Open Database License and  Database Contents License

Please note: This is the Beta version of the app

We hope you enjoy!

comments: I was excited to use this app to avoid egg products. It seemed quite user friendly. I read previous reviews that it doesn't have a very good database for products. I scanned various items in my home (about 15) between condiments, various crackers, cookies, bars etc. Some I knew were egg-free, some I knew were not, some I didn't know and I only had 5 identify that they did not contain my allergen and the rest were not found. This won't be helpful for me and my family, so I uninstalled it.

This app is a great concept but needs a larger database to be more useful. it's lacking several common things such as cereals, pastas etc. I scanned about about 20 things from my pantry but only got results on 5. Keep expanding the data set, this could be a wonderful tool.
Would be helpful to put a chocolate anaphylactic allergy or an option for people to edit the allergy list. Also would be nice for audio playback for those that have a hard time seeing
It has absolutly no database it was a great concept but this app is useless

Do not get this app if you are trying to acually use it. Thos app was created by a middle school atusent and doesn't work when you scan most products I scanned milk to test it and the app said I could have it. Before you scan anything the app asks for your allergies and I put Dairy and then is when I scanned the milk and it said I could have it. Over all this app is NOT a function app.

title: mobiCeliac [Scanner]
description:
WARNING: This app ONLY includes gluten-free info for SPAIN.
--------
mobiCeliac [Scanner] is an app for your device that allows you to get gluten-free food info for SPAIN:
- Use your device camera as a reader of barcode labels (EAN13, UPC, etc) found in packaging of food & drink products and drugs/medicines you can find in SPAIN.
  This app checks automatically whether or not it is included in the Food and Drink Directory and in the Medicines Directory of gluten-free products in SPAIN.
- Learn to recognize all Food Categories and identify the gluten risk or gluten content level
- Learn to spot all product Ingredients and identify the gluten risk or gluten content level

mobiCeliac is the only gluten-free target app for Spain appearing in the "European Directory of Health Apps" promoted by the European Commission (http://www.mobiceliac.com/2013/directorio-europeo-de-aplicaciones-medicas/)

After installing the app, you will need to:
- Purchase a subscription to data updates. It includes a 7 day free trial period to access the full database
  Just select the main option "Settings"  > "License Management" and get your subscription
- Download the database
  Select the main option "Data Update", tap the "Download" button and wait until the data download finishes successfully.
Now you can access more than 20,000+ gluten-free food & drink barcodes and all medicine barcodes that are distributed or sold in SPAIN.

This app is targeted to help people suffering from Coeliac Disease (CD) or other gluten-sensitivity diseases.
The Info Guides are compatible with other Spanish Societies gluten-free products list (ACySG, SMAP and FACE)

title: Cara Care: FODMAP, IBD, IBS Tracker, Poop Tracker
description:
Cara Care takes the mystery out of your digestion. It‚Äôs the easiest way to holistically manage and track GI issues like IBS, IBD, GERD, Celiac, dyspepsia, or food intolerances.

Track and log your poop, stress, food, pain, and other symptoms (e.g. from IBS) with just a few taps. 

The app shows you what your food and symptoms are on your best and worst IBS days.

Start making connections between your diet, your gut, and your overall well-being.

Cara Care‚Äôs premium 12-week IBS program is your personalized guide to following the low FODMAP diet. You‚Äôll get unlimited text chat with a personal dietitian helps you every step of the way in navigating your IBS and beginning low FODMAP. Based on 5,000+ hours of nutritional counseling with people who have IBS. 

-------

UNLIMITED ACCESS TO OUR BEST IN CLASS IBS TRACKER AND POOP TRACKER

üçú Food Tracker: Save time by adding your favorites and photos if you follow low FODMAP, gluten free, or other diets
üßª Poop Tracker: Log different types of bowel movements
üìã Symptom Tracker: Track bloating, constipation, diarrhea, pain, and other IBS symptoms
ü©∫ Medical Log: Record important information about your period, skin, workouts, sleep, pain, and medication

PERSONALIZED ANALYSIS

‚úÖ Food on your best and worst days is shown in your dashboard 
‚úÖ Share your app data easily with your primary care provider or gastroenterologist
‚úÖ Access a library of actionable, science-based tips for living with IBS
‚úÖ Low FODMAP recipes

MAKE LIFE WITH IBS EASIER: JOIN A 12-WEEK IBS LOW FODMAP PROGRAM

üë©‚Äç‚öïÔ∏è Free unlimited text chat with your personal dietitian
üìä Get personalized analysis on your symptoms and diet from your dietitian

üî¨ Get science-backed tips on managing IBS, with actionable takeaways at every step
üìù Track your progress with medically-validated questionnaires 

CARA CARE USER PHOEBE SAYS:

"With Cara Care, for the first time I had the feeling that someone wanted to help me. Thanks to the program, I felt much better! Of course there are problems here and there, but I have made a lot of progress and can enjoy eating again." ‚Äì Phoebe

NOT JUST FOR IBS. 

Cara Care is designed for people with chronic gut conditions such as irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), and IBD (Crohn's disease, ulcerative colitis and microscopic colitis). But Cara Care‚Äôs symptom tracker can also help you with:

‚Ä¢ Bowel problems such as acid reflux, dyspepsia, nausea, chronic abdominal pain, bloating, irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) with symptoms such as chronic bloating, abdominal pain, constipation and diarrhea
‚Ä¢ Short bowel syndrome, small intestinal bacterial overgrowth (SIBO), gastritis, celiac disease
‚Ä¢ Diets such as gluten-free, fructose-free, histamine-free and lactose-free, clean eating, healthy eating, keto
‚Ä¢ Food intolerances and sensitivities such as dairy, lactose, cow's milk allergy, fructose, histamine, gluten/wheat
‚Ä¢ Leaky gut syndrome & Candida albicans
‚Ä¢ Period/menstrual cycle-related digestive problems

We would ‚ù§Ô∏è to hear from you.

Send your questions, suggestions, and feedback to hello@cara.care
Find us on: https://cara.care

comments: Great While It Lasted. I really thought I had found the perfect app to track my symptoms. I spent a huge amount of time entering info. Then, I made the mistake of logging out. Now it won't let me log back in. It says it's sending me a confirmation email to restore my data. But I'm not getting it. I've tried a dozen times & checked my spam/junk folder a hundred times. I'm not receiving the email. I'm so very disappointed. I haven't found another app that covers so much detail. :-(

Adding food and meds can be tedious as a lot of options aren't available. This makes sense as the developer is based in Germany and I live in the US. I also don't add each ingredient, because so many foods have some degree of salt or oil, and those show up in the "best/worst ingredients," even though I know those aren't my triggers. I think the most irritating part is that when I add "no poop" so I can log symptoms, it shows in the report that I pooped. Still a mostly useful app.

I like the idea of this, especially the food tracker to see what foods may be causing me trouble. The only really frustrating part is also the food tracker. They only seem to have half the things I try and put in and it really isn't that user friendly with that function either. The rest of it works pretty well so, despite the food tracker being what I really wanted, I mostly just record symptoms which, in itself, is still helpful.

Great app and is very detailed with a nice user interface. My only critism is when adding pictures to food - it automatically offers to crop or zoom in a landscape rectangle and you can never get the full thing you want in the picture as you can only get part of it. It would be better if it was free crop or zoom within a certain squared area, not a landscape rectangle. An option to export to excel would also be great.
The UI experience is bad and not intuitive. I found it frustrating to use.

title: Low FODMAP diet A to Z food list for IBS sufferers
description:
This app was created by a software developer with Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS) who found the low FODMAP diet to be very effective in avoiding trigger foods. It includes the following key features:

‚úì Clear and simple FODMAP rating system
‚úì Database of 600+ everyday foods and ingredients
‚úì Breakdown of each FODMAP rating (showing oligos, fructose, polyols and lactose content) 
‚úì Search by food name and filter by category/rating to find exactly what you want

If you have IBS and are following the low FODMAP diet to improve your digestive health by avoiding trigger foods then this A to Z food list is for you.

Note: this app is provided for educational purposes only; please ensure you seek the advice of a qualified doctor before making changes to your diet.

comments: Fantastic app. This has made my life so much easier. I do t need to keep looking up food on Google to find out whether it's good to eat. Very clear and easy to understand. Gives you 2 weight allowance amounts as well as red, green or amber. Highly reccomend

This app is super great! I can easily look up food and check if they are low fodmap, in addition to what exactly it has (like oligos, fructose, etc). What could make this even better, is the possibility to look up items such as snacks that are low fodmap.
Great App. Makes looking things up quick and easy. Gives safe serving sizes of items and what FODMAPs they contain. Hope to see many more items added in the future.
Our needs are different. Each person has different problems, let's face it IBS covers a huge range of problems. Great guide. I have one question, whats the little cross for ?
Easy quick way to check safe vs risky foods, with explanation for classification; still a work in the making with missing information

title: Food and Symptoms Tracker - MoodBites IBS Diary
description:
MoodBites is the best food journal to track what you eat and how you feel

It is proven that the food we eat has a direct impact on how we feel. Many times, diseases such as depression, anxiety and inflammation have their roots in the food we eat. Autoimmune diseases and food allergies can not only have a significant impact on the quality of your life and health, but can also be very difficult to understand. MoodBites is meant to deal with this issue and help you learn exactly how the food you eat affects your mood and health. Tracking what you eat and how you feel couldn't be easier - you're just a few taps away from logging the foods you eat and the way you feel.

The food we eat decides whether we feel motivated, focused and sharp or lazy and foggy. Keeping track of how each individual food influences the way we feel can be difficult though - symptoms can even take days before emerging. This is why MoodBites is such an important tool in learning what effects food has on us. MoodBites will show you how the food that you ate changed your mood in the past and even in the future.

MoodBites Features:

- Simple to use: Logging what you eat and how you feel can be done in a few taps

- Smart food auto completion - save time when adding food

- In-depth mood logging: Describe exactly how you feel, both with mood ratings and symptoms

- Symptoms: Understand how the symptoms you experience are linked the food you eat

- Superior food logging: Track not only the food you eat, but also take notes about the quantity, ingredients, etc.

- Diary: Find out exactly how the food you ate affected you, both the day you ate it and for up to 7 days after you ate it

- Calendar: Easily get details about the food you ate and your moods every day

- Insights: Gain an in-depth understanding of how food affected you in the past

- Predictions: Predict how food will influence your mood in the future




 MoodBites does not collect information from the users! 

Credits:
Some graphics are taken from flaticon.com

If MoodBites has helped you live a better life please rate it and share it with the people you care about!

comments: Clean interface and correlation graphics. Need the ability to add my own tags, not just the app's list of allergens.
Great app, if you guys can include a function to upload a specific photo for food I will rate this app 5star. Thanks

This is only my 2nd day with this but: 1) can't seem to insert a food that I forgot about into a prior time; 2) on my android (S7 Active) I can't see the "+" to Submit until I hit the Back key to remove the keyboard; and there was something else but I forgot what it was. I'll keep using it for now since it's the closest thing to what I was looking for.

I like the app but it is lacking functions. For example, it seems like it's not possible to change days on the calendar to add food on a different day (I forgot to log my dinner yesterday and it just goes under today). If the function is there please let me know where xD I would also like to see a time for logging food. The mood logging is also not super clear. App with a potential but need some work, I will gladly change my feedback if it improves :)
Everything is perfect, but when I received a notification for set my mood, I open it, but the notification still after I completed the input.

title: DZG-App
description:
Die DZG-App bietet Sicherheit: Grundlage der App sind die tagesaktuell gepflegten Datenbanken der Deutschen Z√∂liakie-Gesellschaft e.V. (DZG). Diese werden st√§ndig aktualisiert und √ºberpr√ºft, sodass die Daten immer auf dem neuesten Stand sind. Sind Sie sich unsicher, gibt Ihnen das Team der DZG, aus Experten verschiedener Bereiche, gerne kompetente Auskunft. 
Die DZG-App bietet Seriosit√§t: Alle Informationen werden von unseren Fachkr√§ften √ºberpr√ºft und sind verifiziert. Nur best√§tigte Angaben werden in unsere Datenbanken √ºbernommen.
Die DZG-App bietet ein spezielles Angebot f√ºr Z√∂liakiebetroffene, welches Ihnen den Alltag mit Z√∂liakie erleichtert, sodass Sie sorgenfrei glutenfrei leben k√∂nnen. 

Aufstellungen
Hier k√∂nnen Sie auf Basis der DZG-Datenbanken Produkte auf Ihre Glutenfreiheit pr√ºfen. Je nachdem, ob nach Lebensmitteln, Nahrungserg√§nzungsmitteln, Arzneimitteln, Kosmetika usw. gesucht werden soll, w√§hlen Sie die entsprechende Kategorie aus. In den verschiedenen Kategorien k√∂nnen √ºber eine Volltextsuche Produkte gefunden werden, d.h. als Suchbegriff kann sowohl ein Produktname, als auch der Teil des Namens eines Herstellers, oder einer Marke verwendet werden. Auch nach Discounter-Produkten kann gesucht werden. 
Das Suchergebnis wird in zwei Kategorien ausgegeben: oben werden alle Hersteller angezeigt, die den gesuchten Begriff in ihrem Namen tragen. Unten werden alle Produkte angezeigt, auf die der Suchbegriff zutrifft. 
Sollte Ihre Suche keine Treffer ergeben, so erscheint ein Link ‚ÄûAnfrage an die DZG senden‚Äú, √ºber den Sie eine Produktanfrage zu dem gew√ºnschten Artikel an die DZG-Gesch√§ftsstelle senden k√∂nnen.

Sorglos Reisen
Hier k√∂nnen Sie Adressen von Hotels, Restaurants, Kliniken und Kureinrichtungen mit glutenfreiem Angebot finden. Gesucht wird ebenfalls √ºber eine Volltextsuche, d.h. Sie k√∂nnen sowohl nach dem Namen der gew√ºnschten Gastronomie, nach der Postleitzahl oder nach der Stadt suchen. 
√úber das Kartensymbol gelangen Sie zum Kartendienst auf Ihrem Smartphone, dort ist die gew√§hlte Adresse eingezeichnet, sodass Sie sich hierhin navigieren lassen k√∂nnen.
Empfehlungen f√ºr Gastronomie mit glutenfreiem Angebot k√∂nnen Sie √ºber die App per E-Mail an die DZG senden.

Bitte an den Koch
Die ‚ÄûBitte an den Koch‚Äú bietet Ihnen Unterst√ºtzung zur Vermittlung der Bed√ºrfnisse von Z√∂liakiebetroffenen beim Essen au√üer Haus. Die kurze Erkl√§rung f√ºr das Service- und K√ºchenpersonal ist in √ºber 40 Sprachen in der App abrufbar und kann somit auch auf Reisen genutzt werden.
√úber die L√§nderauswahl k√∂nnen Sie das gew√ºnschte Land ausw√§hlen. Es kann jeweils nur ein Land angew√§hlt werden. Die Auswahl best√§tigen Sie mit ‚ÄûFertig‚Äú. 

Hilfe
Im Hilfe-Men√º finden Sie eine detaillierte Beschreibung und Anleitung der Funktionen der App.

Empfohlene Mindestvoraussetzung zur Nutzung der App
Android v4.4 (KitKat) sowie mindestens 1 GB RAM 
Dateigr√∂√üe: Die DZG-App ist 6 MB gro√ü, die Offline-Daten f√ºr die App betragen 16 MB

Die Men√ºpunkte ‚Äû√úber die DZG‚Äú und ‚ÄûHilfe‚Äú sind auch ohne Login zug√§nglich. Alle anderen Bereiche k√∂nnen nur von Mitgliedern der DZG mit g√ºltigen Zugangsdaten freigeschalten werden. 
Die Login-Daten entsprechen denen f√ºr den Mitgliederbereich der DZG-Homepage. Um die Appnutzen zu k√∂nnen, ist deshalb vorab eine Registrierung auf der Homepage notwendig. 
www.dzg-online.de

F√ºr Fragen steht das App-Team der DZG Ihnen gerne unter app@dzg-online.de zur Verf√ºgung.

title: Healthy Celiac Disease - Gluten Free Diet Recipe
description:
Gluten in food is the major cause of celiac disease. There are a variety of foods you can eat which are gluten free. This application contains the best gluten free recipes by top chefs for celiac diet.

People with celiac disease are the original adopters of a gluten-free diet. Celiac disease is a condition characterized by gluten intolerance, which, when gluten is consumed damages the intestinal lining resulting in bloating, chronic diarrhea, constipation, stomach aches, nausea, and vomiting, among others. There is no cure, so the only way for people with celiac disease to avoid these symptoms is to avoid these foods altogether.

When you are diagnosed with Celiac disease or gluten intolerance, your life can become quite difficult if you don't know how or where to find food that is gluten free. The good news is that you can, it just takes a little effort on your part to learn how you can find the foods that you love, gluten free. So..Don't Worry Now, because if You Install the Application that mean you will have the best Celiac Food List Recipes can use to cooking everyday.

If you want to go completely gluten free then Gluten Free or Celiac Cookbook is the best application for you. Gluten Free or Celiac Cookbook Recipes is an effective new recipe application that brings the gluten free world in your fingertips. Beware of market products that claims that they are gluten free. The reality is, they may not be. Use The Free Cookbook application to make gluten free food on your own and be safe. This Celiac Cookbook application contains all the safe/unsafe food list and essential information on living with a gluten free diet.

This is NOT an official but a fan made app. All the logos, trademarks and sources are the properties of their respective owners. We do not endorse in hosting or supporting the channel. If there is any issue, kindly send us an email with full details.

There is no copyright infringement intended, If you are the copyright holder of the images or content on this application and do not want your image displayed, please contact us via email developer and tell us about the status of your ownership over it. We will remove the image. Privacy Policy of the application : http://androitrendpolicy.blogspot.co.id/
