title: Gluten free Recipes: Healthy Cookbook
description:
Gluten free recipes app offers you many quick and easy recipes. These include salad recipes, gluten-free sandwich recipes, soup recipes, stew recipes, gluten-free chocolate recipes, appetizer recipes, recipes for pizza and recipes for snacks.

Festive recipes
Celebrate Chinese New Year with over 100 gluten-free recipes. Also find a number of easy gluten-free recipes for any occasions like Valentine's day, American Super Bowl, Boxing day, Thanksgiving, labour day, St.Patrick‚Äôs Day.

Popular gluten-free food recipes of the month
Recipes like glazed pork and apple kebabs, pork tenderloin, shrimp salad, tex mex stuffed zucchini, Glazed Pork and Apple Kebabs, Pork Tenderloin, Shrimp Salad and Tex Mex Stuffed Zucchini are popular in January & February.

Simple gluten-free recipe instructions with picture
Every gluten-less recipe has easy step by step instructions with a photo. Get many light recipes for free in our Gluten free recipes app. Unlike other recipes app, Gluten free recipes can be used offline. This makes our free recipes app for Android a perfect fit for your kitchen.

Collect favourite non-gluten recipes
Add your favourite healthy gluten-free recipes to the app's favourites section. You can use the saved gluten-less food recipes offline. You can also create gluten-free food recipe collections on the basis of breakfast ideas, cooking and prep time, anti-gluten items, cuisine, lunch ideas etc.

Gluten-Free Recipe search
Find recipes by simple search with the name of a recipe or by ingredients used. You can search for gluten-less recipes with the ingredients you have. We also have Thanksgiving recipes, Christmas recipes, Halloween recipes and other recipe categories for special occasions.

Convert ingredients to a recipe
Our food recipes app lets you cook with ingredients you have. Cook by ingredients feature lets you search and discover non-gluten recipes you can cook with ingredients in your kitchen/refrigerator.

Tastes, allergies and diets
We often have healthy gluten-free recipes for people following vegetarian, gluten-free, vegan and keto diets. If you're suffering from any food allergies, we have peanut-free recipes, egg-free recipes, wheat-free recipes, lactose-free recipes and dairy-free. Nutritional information like calories, fat, carbs and cholesterol are available in the Gluten free recipes app.

Create Meal plans
Meal planning is going to be tasty and healthy with Gluten free recipes. Start eating gluten-less food recipes with proper meal planner ideas and grocery shopping list. With simple meal planner ideas get healthy gluten-free recipes.

We offer lots of gluten-free food recipes:
Cook tasty gluten-free recipes at home using cayenne pepper, zucchini, butter & scallions. Recipes for classic gluten-less dishes like grilled skirt steak, chicken and white bean chili, honey balsamic glazed chicken, fish chowder sheet pan bake and roasted spaghetti squash are available in the app. Our favourite non-gluten recipes include crispy chicken thighs, sesame chicken, and enchiladas with pumpkin seed salsa.

Our healthy gluten-free recipe app gives you lots of free cooking recipes for dessert, chicken, waffles etc. Now that you've our gluten-less food recipes app, you no longer need to carry around bulky recipe books.

Start cooking with our free recipes app today.

title: NoFoodPain: Food intolerance allergy & sensitivity
description: Most people with food intolerance are sensitive to more than one chemical. This app helps people to figure out which food to remove from their diets and what to replace them with and exploring the most common foods available to reduce uncomfortable symptoms, noFoodPain App can easily keep track of your diet by adding food to your Allowed or Avoided food list. This app also helps people suffering from IBD or IBS to track their Diet. Please note this App is only a guide, We added Salicylates, Histamine, Amines, Gluten, Fructose, Sulfite, FODMAP, Sulfur, Purine, Lactose and Fructan Intolerance/Sensitivity, and Allergy. We are always trying to update our app as soon as possible with new data.
descriptionHTML: Most people with food intolerance are sensitive to more than one chemical. This app helps people to figure out which food to remove from their diets and what to replace them with and exploring the most common foods available to reduce uncomfortable symptoms, noFoodPain App can easily keep track of your diet by adding food to your Allowed or Avoided food list. This app also helps people suffering from IBD or IBS to track their Diet. Please note this App is only a guide, We added Salicylates, Histamine, Amines, Gluten, Fructose, Sulfite, FODMAP, Sulfur, Purine, Lactose and Fructan Intolerance/Sensitivity, and Allergy. We are always trying to update our app as soon as possible with new data.
summary: A simple Food Diary App about Food intolerance allergy and sensitivity.
recentChanges: Fixed some bugs
comments: This is a very basic list without any sort functions and 3 stars might be generous. Needs more information, food varieties, the ability to sort by intolerance, and ability to eat level. I deleted it because it doesn't seem helpful enough. After adding all my foods it would be too confusing without a sort function.

This app is horrible. All of the information on the foods regarding Salicylates and histamines is incorrect! Anyone following a low amine or salicylates diet DO NOT USE IT. It also has way too many adds. I couldn't use it for less than a minute without another add coming on.
very usefull and easy to use

title: Gluten Free Restaurants Guide for Celiacs
description:
CeliHack - The only gluten free restaurant and meal guide based on real recommendations from people with Celiac!

CeliHack was created by a Celiac - for Celiacs! It was created to perform as an actual gluten-free dishes collection from restaurants, where all the dishes are uploaded by us - Celiacs!

Suffering from Celiac disease? Living on a gluten free diet? Here's your solution for eating out! 
CeliHack is the best gluten free restaurant guide that is 100% based on actual recommendations! 
What does this mean? 

- If you enjoyed a delicious and safe gluten-free meal at a Celiac-friendly restaurant - upload your recommendation and let other people know!

- Had a meal that was supposed to be gluten free but suffered from Celiac side effects afterwards? Warn other people!

- Want to have a gluten free breakfast, lunch or dinner at a restaurant and you don't know which you can really trust? With CeliHack you can find out where Celiacs near you ate and marked as safe! 

Are you a Celiac too? Download the app and help us build the world's biggest gluten free dishes collection! 

Main advantages:

1. Presenting not just a list of restaurants which claim to serve gluten-free dishes, but actually showing those dishes, photographed and uploaded by other Celiacs who ate the dishes and shared how they felt after doing so!

2. Based on the wisdom of the crowd: each user can comment on others‚Äô recommendations. So, if someone uploaded a dish that you already ate and had a different experience with it (for better or worse), you can add your review to the existing ‚Äúdish card‚Äù and notify others about your experience too. 

3. The app may change the way restaurants handle our food‚Ä¶ maybe they don‚Äôt even know their GF dishes are not actually GF.

4. Since the database should be built by us - Celiacs - it‚Äôs worldwide and can help us anywhere in the world.

In order to start making a difference, we need volunteers to start uploading gluten-free dishes in their location. Since the app is new, it pretty much has no dishes in it, so you‚Äôll probably see this empty screen when first opening it, asking you to start contributing content‚Ä¶ We hope you will!

The app is free and will ALWAYS be free to Celiacs!

If we all cooperate and share our recommendations - we‚Äôll bring traffic to the restaurants which take care of us, and it may convince the ones who don‚Äôt to start doing so too!

Please help us by uploading dishes to the app. A strong worldwide community will help us all by raising awareness! 

How can you give back to the community?

- Opened the app in a place where no one has uploaded a dish before? Be the first to upload a dish there and help future visitors! 
- Got sick from eating, but not sure it is from gluten? Report it (anonymously) anyway; if the restaurant is good, others will balance it out in the future with their reviews.
- Came across inappropriate content (e.g. photo or text) in the app? Report the dish.
- Most importantly, keep sharing gluten free dishes you ate out and tell other Celiacs how you felt after the meal. 

Celihack Features include:

- Swipe through real recommendations of meals and choose if you like it or don‚Äôt like it
- Add meals to ‚ÄòMy Favorites‚Äô and save for when you get hungry and want to eat at a safe Celiac friendly restaurant
- Upload your own recommendations or rejections after eating a gluten free meal
- Find Celiac friendly restaurants near you

With CaliHack you can easily find gluten friendly restaurants around you! Download now and find restaurants that offer a gluten free menu and enjoy a gluten free breakfast, gluten free beer and more! 

This app was created by a Celiac, especially for people with Celiac, to help keep your gluten free diet safe!

CONNECT WITH US
We are always happy to receive feedback from our users to help improve the app: 

Email- celihack.team@gmail.com
Website- http://celihack.com/
Facebook- https://www.facebook.com/CeliHack
Instagram- https://www.instagram.com/celihack/

CeliHack - The only gluten free restaurant and meal guide based on real recommendations from people with Celiac!

CeliHack was created by a Celiac - for Celiacs! It was created to perform as an actual gluten-free dishes collection from restaurants, where all the dishes are uploaded by us - Celiacs!

Suffering from Celiac disease? Living on a gluten free diet? Here's your solution for eating out!
CeliHack is the best gluten free restaurant guide that is 100% based on actual recommendations!
What does this mean?

- If you enjoyed a delicious and safe gluten-free meal at a Celiac-friendly restaurant - upload your recommendation and let other people know!

- Had a meal that was supposed to be gluten free but suffered from Celiac side effects afterwards? Warn other people!

- Want to have a gluten free breakfast, lunch or dinner at a restaurant and you don't know which you can really trust? With CeliHack you can find out where Celiacs near you ate and marked as safe!

Are you a Celiac too? Download the app and help us build the world's biggest gluten free dishes collection!

Main advantages:

1. Presenting not just a list of restaurants which claim to serve gluten-free dishes, but actually showing those dishes, photographed and uploaded by other Celiacs who ate the dishes and shared how they felt after doing so!

2. Based on the wisdom of the crowd: each user can comment on others‚Äô recommendations. So, if someone uploaded a dish that you already ate and had a different experience with it (for better or worse), you can add your review to the existing ‚Äúdish card‚Äù and notify others about your experience too.

3. The app may change the way restaurants handle our food‚Ä¶ maybe they don‚Äôt even know their GF dishes are not actually GF.

4. Since the database should be built by us - Celiacs - it‚Äôs worldwide and can help us anywhere in the world.

In order to start making a difference, we need volunteers to start uploading gluten-free dishes in their location. Since the app is new, it pretty much has no dishes in it, so you‚Äôll probably see this empty screen when first opening it, asking you to start contributing content‚Ä¶ We hope you will!

The app is free and will ALWAYS be free to Celiacs!

If we all cooperate and share our recommendations - we‚Äôll bring traffic to the restaurants which take care of us, and it may convince the ones who don‚Äôt to start doing so too!

Please help us by uploading dishes to the app. A strong worldwide community will help us all by raising awareness!

How can you give back to the community?

- Opened the app in a place where no one has uploaded a dish before? Be the first to upload a dish there and help future visitors!
- Got sick from eating, but not sure it is from gluten? Report it (anonymously) anyway; if the restaurant is good, others will balance it out in the future with their reviews.
- Came across inappropriate content (e.g. photo or text) in the app? Report the dish.
- Most importantly, keep sharing gluten free dishes you ate out and tell other Celiacs how you felt after the meal.

Celihack Features include:

- Swipe through real recommendations of meals and choose if you like it or don‚Äôt like it
- Add meals to ‚ÄòMy Favorites‚Äô and save for when you get hungry and want to eat at a safe Celiac friendly restaurant
- Upload your own recommendations or rejections after eating a gluten free meal
- Find Celiac friendly restaurants near you

With CaliHack you can easily find gluten friendly restaurants around you! Download now and find restaurants that offer a gluten free menu and enjoy a gluten free breakfast, gluten free beer and more!

This app was created by a Celiac, especially for people with Celiac, to help keep your gluten free diet safe!

CONNECT WITH US
We are always happy to receive feedback from our users to help improve the app:

Email- celihack.team@gmail.com
Website- http://celihack.com/
Facebook- https://www.facebook.com/CeliHack
Instagram- https://www.instagram.com/celihack/
summary: CeliHack: Gluten free restaurants guide based on reviews of people with Celiac
recentChanges: Bug fixes
comments:
Not intuitive to use, I wanted to try out some other apps, and not just use 
My current go to app all the time, but I guess that was a waist of my time 
:-)
Unable to view anything, says nothing available in my area. Will only let me add new dishes

I'm sure once people start to upload the app will become useful.  But for now it feels empty and unnecessary clunky with being forced to turn on GPS, seeing nothing available and not being able to look at other areas. We're going away in a couple of weeks and would like to look at were we can eat, but the app won't let us, it's looking us into the area the GPS knows were at right now. Please change this.
I prefer to determine when my location can be accessed. The app will not let me move forward without turning it on.
This is amazing app, I so love it!

title: Gluten Free Eating Directory
description:
Find gluten free restaurants, shops, manufacturers and more for FREE on the GLUTEN FREE EATING DIRECTORY Android application!

This app allows you to search our comprehensive database of Aussie gluten free businesses by name, food type or location.

FEATURES
- Browse our entire web database quickly and easily from your mobile phone.
- Instantly find a place to eat nearby by pressing "GF Near Me".
- Add GF businesses to your contact book for offline look-up.
- Get directions to your favourite GF restaurants and shops (GPS required).
- Find websites to purchase GF goods online.

comments: App gets stuck in loops and throws 404 errors. Doesn't have native content it redirects to website rather staying in the app. When it works it lists places that do not provide a coeliac safe prep error, pizza place listed near me preps gluten free bases in same place as normal pizzas with flour everywhere..

We use it all the time, very helpful and majority of listings have worked out well. Only thing I'd like added is a map view so when you're out in an unfamiliar area you could easily see what was around or on your route to somewhere etc
Useless. Doesn't even have 5% of businesses listed.Better to use Aus coeliac or website.
Good
Good thought sir

title: Endive - IBS FODMAP Food Diary & Symptoms Tracker
description:
Simply track what you eat, your symptoms and moods and Endive will help you identify correlations in a visual graph form.

Food is a common trigger of digestive symptoms. Avoiding certain foods or keeping a low FODMAP diet can dramatically improve issues like gas, bloating, stomach pain, diarrhoea, constipation and others.

However, everyone is different and there is no one-size-fits-all IBS diet: Keeping a diary of what you eat and how you feel is vital to learning what triggers your symptoms.

Take charge of your digestion and gut health.

üìâPERSONALISED TRACKER 
Add custom foods and symptoms that are personal to you and track them together with the others. Endive knows recipes and breaks them down into ingredients to make IBS tracking faster and more efficient.

If you have a condition you know about, but want to optimise your diet to help improve your symptoms, Endive helps you keep track of what you have eaten and how you feel, both physically and psychologically. This allows you to learn how your body reacts to different foods ü•ë, or which triggers (e.g. anxiety, depression) are causing you symptoms.

üìäWIDE RANGING TRACKER

Endive helps you manage conditions such as:

‚úÖ IBS (Irritable Bowel Syndrome)
‚úÖ IBD (Inflammatory Bowel Disease)
‚úÖ Food intolerance and sensitivities (such as Dairy, Wheat/Gluten, Lactose)
‚úÖ Acid reflux
‚úÖ Crohn‚Äôs disease
‚úÖ Coeliac disease
‚úÖ SIBO (Small Intestinal Bacterial Overgrowth)
‚úÖ Ulcerative colitis
‚úÖ Migraines & cluster headaches
‚úÖ Skin issues (such as Eczema, Acne)
‚úÖ Period / menstrual cycle related issues
‚úÖ Bloating, heartburn, and many other digestive conditions

üî¨FODMAP TRACKER
Want to track your FODMAP diet? üçí
FODMAP‚Äôs are types of carbohydrates that are poorly absorbed by the body. Studies show strong links between them and digestive IBS symptoms. A low FODMAP diet can have remarkable benefits if you struggle with these issues.

If you want to take your tracking to the next level, get weekly reports with Endive Plus that highlight high and low FODMAP foods in your diet so you can learn which of them might have caused your symptoms.

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

We'd love to hear your thoughts üí≠

üí°Send your questions, feedback and bug reports to feedback@endive.app

comments: Helpful for keeping track of food and symptoms but definitely not an app for a newbie. New to having to keep an eye on FODMAPS so wish it was easier to see which was what. There is the ability to pay for highlighting of this but I didn't find the highlights were on each food item. As well, the food options assume you're making things from scratch. Or some searches food items just didn't result in anything and I had to manually add each ingredient. Definitely not gonna be doing that takes forever

I've used several apps to track my IBS-C. I know the developer is still working on this app, but so far I like it. They have a great selection of food items and recipes already in the database. You can easily adjust the recipes, too. After every entry it asks you to rate your triggers (bloating, constipation, etc) which I LOVE! I'm so bad about tracking those. There is no export option yet, which I hope comes soon. Using the free version and there are no ads, either.

Found this app really disappointing. The high/low fodmap scoring is behind a paywall. Additionally I lost confidence in the food directory, hardly any of the meals I get from the supermarket are in the directory.
User experience is just really cluttered. I looked for my regular low fodmap items in the meal directory and could not find any of them. Going to keep looking for a helpful fodmap food diary
I use it for my IBS and how bloated I am etc good reminder.

title: Gluten Free recipes with photo offline
descriptionHTML:
A gluten-free diet (GFD) is a diet that strictly excludes gluten, a mixture of proteins found in wheat and related grains, including barley, rye, oat, and all their species and hybrids (such as spelt, kamut, and triticale). Gluten is a composite of storage proteins termed prolamins.

Gluten proteins have low nutritional and biological value, and the grains that contain gluten are not essential in the human diet. However, an unbalanced selection of food and an incorrect choice of gluten-free replacement products may lead to nutritional deficiencies. Quinoa, amaranth, and buckwheat are healthy alternatives to these prepared products and have high biological and nutritional value. A gluten-free diet should be mainly based on naturally gluten-free foods with a good balance of micro and macro nutrients: meat, fish, eggs, milk and dairy products, legumes, nuts, fruits, vegetables, potatoes, rice, and maize are all appropriate components of such a diet.

Gluten Free recipes with photo offline don't require the Internet and your favorite recipes' application will always be with you, even when you haven't wi-fi.

We offer a lot of Gluten Free recipes. It is all in our recipes app for free download.

Try to explore the variety of offline available Gluten Free recipes. Our experiences inspire home cooking, celebrate the food you make and let you share your successes with friends, family and followers. You can try your hands on the gluten-free recipes app for free! These are an excellent gluten free recipes. Sounds great, get you new cookbook! You are —Åhef today.

- almond flour brownies;
- baked slow cooker chicken;

- florentine artichoke dip;
- flourless chocolate cake;
- foolproof rib roast;
- garbanzo bean chocolate cake;
- gluten-free banana walnut chia muffins;
- gluten-free pizza crust or flatbread;
- green beans with cherry tomatoes;
- grilled asparagus;
- grilled marinated shrimp;
- grilled shrimp scampi;
- grilled tilapia with mango salsa;
- hot artichoke spinach dip;
- juicy roasted chicken;
- lamb chops with balsamic reduction;
- paleo pecan-maple salmon;
- refried beans without the refry;
- roast leg of lamb with rosemary;

- warm flourless chocolate cake with caramel sauce; - etc. awesome recipes!

*** Absolutely FREE cookbook application ***
*** Works OFFLINE without internet ***

Features of our "recipe book free download" app:
- Step by step instructions. Recipe book offline.
- Full list of ingredients in recipes. Recipe app in English.
- Cooking time. Quick and easy food recipes.
- Number of servings per person. Cooking recipes apps.
- Search function (search by name, ingredients, alcohol volume, method etc.).
- FAVORITE RECIPES. Manage your favourite dishes and have them quickly accessible in a separate tab.
- DISH DETAILS. Description, detailed recipe with variations and a list of needed ingredients including garnish.
- Calories in each meal. Recipe calculator.
- Directions for each dish. Food recipes free.
- Quick and easy healthy meals with pictures.
- Step by step photo. Drink Recipes instructions.
- Alphabetical list and recipes for kids.
- Cooking recipe book offline.
- Grocery shopping list.

These Gluten Free recipes are a perfect rendition of what you could get from any deli. It is simple to make and great to taste.

- Add meals to ‚ÄòMy Favorites‚Äô and save for when you get hungry and want to eat at a safe Celiac friendly restaurant
- Upload your own recommendations or rejections after eating a gluten free meal
- Find Celiac friendly restaurants near you

With CaliHack you can easily find gluten friendly restaurants around you! Download now and find restaurants that offer a gluten free menu and enjoy a gluten free breakfast, gluten free beer and more!

This app was created by a Celiac, especially for people with Celiac, to help keep your gluten free diet safe!

CONNECT WITH US
We are always happy to receive feedback from our users to help improve the app:

Email- celihack.team@gmail.com
Website- http://celihack.com/
Facebook- https://www.facebook.com/CeliHack

:-)
Unable to view anything, says nothing available in my area. Will only let me add new dishes

title: Gluten Free Eating Directory

Find gluten free restaurants, shops, manufacturers and more for FREE on the GLUTEN FREE EATING DIRECTORY Android application!

This app allows you to search our comprehensive database of Aussie gluten free businesses by name, food type or location.

title: Endive - IBS FODMAP Food Diary & Symptoms Tracker
description:
Simply track what you eat, your symptoms and moods and Endive will help you identify correlations in a visual graph form.

Food is a common trigger of digestive symptoms. Avoiding certain foods or keeping a low FODMAP diet can dramatically improve issues like gas, bloating, stomach pain, diarrhoea, constipation and others.

However, everyone is different and there is no one-size-fits-all IBS diet: Keeping a diary of what you eat and how you feel is vital to learning what triggers your symptoms.

Take charge of your digestion and gut health.

üìâPERSONALISED TRACKER 
Add custom foods and symptoms that are personal to you and track them together with the others. Endive knows recipes and breaks them down into ingredients to make IBS tracking faster and more efficient.

If you have a condition you know about, but want to optimise your diet to help improve your symptoms, Endive helps you keep track of what you have eaten and how you feel, both physically and psychologically. This allows you to learn how your body reacts to different foods ü•ë, or which triggers (e.g. anxiety, depression) are causing you symptoms.

üìäWIDE RANGING TRACKER

Endive helps you manage conditions such as:

‚úÖ IBS (Irritable Bowel Syndrome)
‚úÖ IBD (Inflammatory Bowel Disease)
‚úÖ Food intolerance and sensitivities (such as Dairy, Wheat/Gluten, Lactose)
‚úÖ Acid reflux
‚úÖ Crohn‚Äôs disease
‚úÖ Coeliac disease
‚úÖ SIBO (Small Intestinal Bacterial Overgrowth)
‚úÖ Ulcerative colitis
‚úÖ Migraines & cluster headaches
‚úÖ Skin issues (such as Eczema, Acne)
‚úÖ Period / menstrual cycle related issues
‚úÖ Bloating, heartburn, and many other digestive conditions

üî¨FODMAP TRACKER
Want to track your FODMAP diet? üçí
FODMAP‚Äôs are types of carbohydrates that are poorly absorbed by the body. Studies show strong links between them and digestive IBS symptoms. A low FODMAP diet can have remarkable benefits if you struggle with these issues.

If you want to take your tracking to the next level, get weekly reports with Endive Plus that highlight high and low FODMAP foods in your diet so you can learn which of them might have caused your symptoms.

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

We'd love to hear your thoughts üí≠

üí°Send your questions, feedback and bug reports to feedback@endive.app

comments: Helpful for keeping track of food and symptoms but definitely not an app for a newbie. New to having to keep an eye on FODMAPS so wish it was easier to see which was what. There is the ability to pay for highlighting of this but I didn't find the highlights were on each food item. As well, the food options assume you're making things from scratch. Or some searches food items just didn't result in anything and I had to manually add each ingredient. Definitely not gonna be doing that takes forever

I've used several apps to track my IBS-C. I know the developer is still working on this app, but so far I like it. They have a great selection of food items and recipes already in the database. You can easily adjust the recipes, too. After every entry it asks you to rate your triggers (bloating, constipation, etc) which I LOVE! I'm so bad about tracking those. There is no export option yet, which I hope comes soon. Using the free version and there are no ads, either.

Found this app really disappointing. The high/low fodmap scoring is behind a paywall. Additionally I lost confidence in the food directory, hardly any of the meals I get from the supermarket are in the directory.
User experience is just really cluttered. I looked for my regular low fodmap items in the meal directory and could not find any of them. Going to keep looking for a helpful fodmap food diary
I use it for my IBS and how bloated I am etc good reminder.

title: Gluten Free recipes with photo offline
descriptionHTML:
A gluten-free diet (GFD) is a diet that strictly excludes gluten, a mixture of proteins found in wheat and related grains, including barley, rye, oat, and all their species and hybrids (such as spelt, kamut, and triticale). Gluten is a composite of storage proteins termed prolamins.

Gluten proteins have low nutritional and biological value, and the grains that contain gluten are not essential in the human diet. However, an unbalanced selection of food and an incorrect choice of gluten-free replacement products may lead to nutritional deficiencies. Quinoa, amaranth, and buckwheat are healthy alternatives to these prepared products and have high biological and nutritional value. A gluten-free diet should be mainly based on naturally gluten-free foods with a good balance of micro and macro nutrients: meat, fish, eggs, milk and dairy products, legumes, nuts, fruits, vegetables, potatoes, rice, and maize are all appropriate components of such a diet.

Gluten Free recipes with photo offline don't require the Internet and your favorite recipes' application will always be with you, even when you haven't wi-fi.

We offer a lot of Gluten Free recipes. It is all in our recipes app for free download.

Try to explore the variety of offline available Gluten Free recipes. title: Vegan Gluten Free Scanner
description:
Instead of going through the full ingredients list. Simply scan the barcode of the food or drink product to learn if the product is right for you.

Vegan, Vegetarian people struggle the most to learn if the product is right for them.
As well as people on gluten-free diet or with nuts,dairy allergy.

Our database has over 200,000 food and drinks products. The database is constantly updated and is growing.

Scanning product will give you following summary:
* Vegan
* Vegetarian
* Gluten Free
* Dairy
* Egg
* Meat
* Nuts
* Chemicals/Preservatives



**NOTE** 
The information displayed are based on the origin of the ingredients. Some ingredients may have multiple origin (e.g. plants and animals), in such cases both the origin are considered. 

Vervet does not provide medical advice. 

Manufacturers might change ingredients. In such cases please read the label carefully.

Suggestions are most welcome.

comments: Pretty good so far. It's had some product I've scanned. I wish it had a search option, and even ability for others to contribute scanned foods. I've a few things I could scan real quick for others info.
Loved this app years ago, but I just uploaded again and scanned some basic products. It was incorrect (it said Tofutti contained dairy) and didn't recognize my other products.

I like how easy it is to identify if gluten free. Unfortunately, I am finding a fair amount of stuff that doesn't register. Hopefully they will expand their data base because I really like the functionality of this app.
It almost never finds the product. Unless it's a very common item. I thought the whole point was to be able to scan any item and see if it's gluten free. Oh well it was worth a try.

I have only just started using the app, overall, I am very pleased. I would like it better if, when ingredients tiles are shown, that you could click that tile and find out what ingredient name is being used Which type of nut, or what chemical name they are usung for an animal product . For example, Nutty Bars, your scan indicates meat or fish. I can't tell which ingredient that is and I would like to know so I won't be fooled again!

title: recipeezi Gluten Free
description:
More yum, less ho-hum! Everything you need to lead a delicious gluten free life. Proudly endorsed by Coeliac Australia. 

Simple and tasty gluten free recipes, the whole family will love, with new seasonal recipes added monthly. We‚Äôve taken the hassle out of grocery shopping with our simple one click shopping list.

It‚Äôs never been so easy to eat well. 

ABOUT THE APP 
The recipeezi Gluten Free App is about sharing simple, fresh and delicious recipes, designed to make dinner time easy ‚Äì from planning, to shopping and cooking, it‚Äôs the perfect kitchen companion. 

Here‚Äôs what you can expect to find:
‚Ä¢	hundreds of FAMILY FRIENDLY, gluten free recipes, loved by kids and adults alike (even the fussy eaters)
‚Ä¢	easy and delicious recipes for BREAKFAST, LUNCH and DINNER (and everything in between)
‚Ä¢	Apple Crumble to Zucchini Fritters ‚Äì A to Z we‚Äôve got it all
‚Ä¢	NEW SEASONAL recipes added every monthly, to keep you inspired
‚Ä¢	have dinner on the table in LESS THAN 30 MINUTES. 
‚Ä¢	we‚Äôve taken the hassle out of grocery shopping with GLUTEN FREE PRODUCT RECOMMENDATIONS, allowing you to shop and cook with confidence.  
‚Ä¢	every recipe examined and ENDORSED BY COELIAC AUSTRALIA
‚Ä¢	never forget a vital ingredient again with the ONE CLICK SHOPPING LIST sorted by supermarket aisle. You can even add your own items not included in the recipes or share your list with a friend who will do the shopping for you! 
‚Ä¢	REDUCE THE SIZE OF THE SHOPPING BILL and your food waste - only buy what you need with the dynamic shopping list automatically adding up ingredients (nice!)
‚Ä¢	POWERFUL RECIPE SEARCH with everything sorted by meal, main ingredient, season or how long it takes to cook. Search it your way!

‚Ä¢	PERSONALISE YOUR COLLECTION by saving recipes to favourites and adding your own notes to keep track of who you have cooked the recipe for and what they think.

If you need help or have a suggestion, please contact us at hello@hellotable.com.au and we will get it sorted.

title: Gluten Free on the Move
description:
We‚Äôve made eating out gluten free easier for you. Our app helps you find suitable venues while out and about. Whether it‚Äôs to grab food on the go or find a suitable venue for a special occasion you can check through thousands of venues that also come with reviews and ratings from our community. Over half of the venues have our GF accreditation so you can be reassured meals are safely prepared and the venues meet all the aspects of our gluten free standard. 

This app is FREE for Coeliac UK members and is one of the many features of Coeliac UK membership.

Features:
‚Ä¢	Search through thousands of suitable venues across the UK, with a range of cuisine types
‚Ä¢	Recommendation made from our trusted local groups and gluten free community
‚Ä¢	Map view with ‚Äòtake me there‚Äô features
‚Ä¢	Eating out tips to help make eating out more enjoyable, including questions to ask to check and safeguard your health
‚Ä¢	Add even more venues- if you‚Äôve had a good experience at a new venue then you can share them with us

summary: Living gluten-free need not be a challenge with our Gluten-free on the Move app.
developerAddress: Apollo Centre, Desborough Rd, High Wycombe HP11 2QW
recentChanges: Updated for latest software releases and undertaken minor bug fixes and amendments. Many thanks for your ongoing feedback.
comments: This app needs a lot of work to be truly useful. The scanner, which is the most important part of the app, doesn't even work. While there is a lot of other good information on it, much of it is already on their website.  I am a member of Coeliac UK, and I'm just keeping this app now in hopes that it will be improved in time seeing as I've got all the time in the world since my coeliac isn't going away. Until then, there are other apps that are more useful.

App won't even open any more. just crashes immediately. I tried removing and reinstalling but no luck. Update: Tried again after Sep 2019 update - version 2.0.5, still no luck unfortunately. I've uninstalled it. Shame, it used to be really good.

It was a great app but the scanner has disappeared and it is now ruined! I used the scanner all the time when shopping and/or unsure if I could have something. The app is absolutely useless now! get the scanner up again please! Very unhappy with the latest update

this is a terrible "improvement"! Where is the food directory? I used to love the ability scan barcodes and quickly check if something was gf. now I just get Cote (I assume sponsored) listings being prominently displayed. a step backwards I feel.

I haven't used the app for a while but installed it again today and it wont let me log in, changed my password, installed again but still no joy Password is fine on Chrome or Samsung's browser so think the app is talking to the server maybe

title: Coeliac Australia
description:
Coeliac Australia's Ingredient List details over 800 ingredients and 300 additives used in Australian and New Zealand foods and indicates whether they are safe for inclusion in a gluten free diet. NOTE: ONLY APPLIES TO FOODS SOLD IN AUSTRALIA & NEW ZEALAND

In order to follow a gluten free diet, it is essential to become ingredient aware and an expert label reader. As products and their ingredients change constantly, Coeliac Australia is not able to recommend brands of products.

By becoming ingredient aware you are able to take control of your diet and increase your choice of suitable products.
descriptionHTML:
Coeliac Australia's Ingredient List details over 800 ingredients and 300 additives used in Australian and New Zealand foods and indicates whether they are safe for inclusion in a gluten free diet. NOTE: ONLY APPLIES TO FOODS SOLD IN AUSTRALIA & NEW ZEALAND

In order to follow a gluten free diet, it is essential to become ingredient aware and an expert label reader. As products and their ingredients change constantly, Coeliac Australia is not able to recommend brands of products.

By becoming ingredient aware you are able to take control of your diet and increase your choice of suitable products.
summary: Coeliac Australia's Ingredient List.
recentChanges:
Content updates
Miscellaneous improvement
comments: Not worth the cost at all. I could literally find this list on google as thats really all this app is. A list. I thought it would have actual food items as well as the individual ingredients or maybe some form of barcode scanner for foods.

Clarity around food containing gluten. This app would be so much better, with capabilty to scan barcodes, to identify foods containing gluten. If dietry related apps have this for portion / calorie calculating, surely it can be done for gluten content ? Please consider. Also, the list of foods needs updating. It doesn't list the likes of sweet chilli sauce or even ham. Lots of foods missing

I have been reading labels for 4 years now and I still use this app for ingredients I'm not sure about. It is far more accurate than googling or scanning barcodes as others have suggested, especially if you are a coeliac.

Hardly worth the cost, given most similar apps provide the same or better functionality and are free. Given there is not product information, why is this app any better than doing a web search on your phone while out shopping?
Information that you could quite easily find on Google. There is no search function or barcode scanned. Pretty useless really.

description:

With the help of Gluten Free Card you'll be able to order a safe gluten-free meal in the most popular languages in the world.

comments: No mandarin, the language i need the most often. Also the search is a challenge because i try to type and it throws a ton of text that has nothing to do with my search. Fox these two things and I'm sure it'll get 5 stars
Great app for going on holiday or business trips. Going to save me opening Google translate at dinner every evening I'm away from home. Can't wait for more languages to come!
Once more languages are added, this will be perfect.
Not flexible to include allergies
Junk

title: AiC Mobile
description:
The Italian Coeliac Association (AIC) provide all its members with an App enhancing the quality of daily life of people affected by Coeliac Disease: AIC Mobile.

Thank to this App, people affected by Coeliac Disease have the opportunity to find gluten free products and safe venues on their smartphone or tablet, everywhere, at home, on holiday and on a business trip.

AIC Mobile App has different sections: Eating Out, Food&Drink Directory, Gluten-free store, to choose where to buy and to eat gluten free in the most safe and comfortable way.

AIC Mobile can be downloaded for free by members, but everybody can purchase a temporary version. The temporary version fees will help the Association realizing new activities and supporting people affected by coeliac disease. You can help AIC and find out useful information to improve the quality of life of people affected by Coeliac Disease and their relatives just with a tap!

Furthermore, a Free version is available to spread correct information about Coealiac Disease and Dermatitis herpetiformis.

Not a member yet? Join AIC now!

Click your Region on the map and become a member with an annual fee.

Just ‚Ç¨ 0.10 per day can make AIC, representing people affected by Coeliac Disease in Italy, stronger!

I can not make a payment. for Welcome version The payment is rejected. I buy different App in Google Play without any problems so I assume that it is something wrong wirh AIC App.

Questa app la utilizzo spesso! Estremamente funzionale per avere sempre con me da consultare il prontuario o l'abc del celiaco, nel caso ho dei dubbi mentre faccio la spesa o mi offrono prodotti da mangiare che non conosco. Uso solo questa app per trovare rapidamente dei locali dove poter andare a mangiare in sicurezza!

title: Gluten Free 24/7
description:
Gluten-Free 24/7 was created in collaboration with the Canadian Celiac Association, as a tool to assist persons dealing with celiac disease or gluten sensitivity when trying to shop for safe gluten-free foods.

It can be difficult to know which foods contain gluten... Gluten Free 24/7 takes the guesswork away, and makes it easier to maintain a Gluten Free diet.

Purchase the app today to help you stay Gluten Free ‚Äì 24/7!

summary: Gluten Free 24/7 makes it easier to maintain a Gluten Free diet.
developerAddress:
21 William St.
Parry Sound ON P2A 1V2
recentChanges: Gluten Free 24/7 is finally available on Google Play!
comments: WONDERFUL!! Recommended by the Dieticians after a recent Celiac Disease diagnosis in my family. This has made trips to the grocery store MUCH LESS stressful. I no longer need to remember a million "gluten-poisons". The app does that for me!! Also, when I purchased it, the App was automatically added to my Google Family Library so EVERYONE in my family who needs this can benefit. VERY HAPPY with my purchase!

title: Gluten-Free Boy
description:
ENDLESS REPLAYABILITY

The vastness of space results in infinite asteroid belts to maneuver through and around. Gluten-Free Boy experiences a new adventure every time he flies.

CHARMING VISUALS

The vibrant, crisp asteroids are almost attractive enough to eat. (Disclaimer: Do not eat your device or fly Gluten-Free Boy into asteroids; he is gluten-free, after all.)

COMPLETELY AND UTTERLY FREE

Gluten-Free Boy is completely devoid of any type of monetary transactions and advertisements, and will never try to solicit any money from you. We might as well rename it Completely-Free Boy.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Note: Gluten-Free Boy and Zach Johnson Games do not wish to insult, belittle, or lessen the seriousness of celiac's disease or other gluten intolerances (Zach is gluten-free himself).

recentChanges: Added new donut asteroid, fixed some various laser bugs.
comments: Loved the story. The special fx are amazing and the plot was super in depth and well thought out. I almost forgot it was a game cuz I thought I was watching a James Cameron movie. I can't wait for the second version of the game, ebola-free boy. Heard it's starring Com Truise. Yeay. (Honestly though, congrats Zach. This is amazing and deserves much more attention)
This game is the best thing to ever be found on the appstore. Can't go an hour without thinking about it or playing it. SOOO MUCH FUN. 10/10
It cured me of Ebola, and now I can even eat gluten, 8/8 app.
A true gem, especially for a lone wolf programmer. First game I ever played on this phone, definitely a keeper!
Honestly, this deserves game of the year. This is an artistic Triumph for the the ages.

title: Gluten-free recipes for healthy eating
description:
Every day there are more cases of people who have an intolerance to wheat, that is, they are recognized as having celiac disease, which is how this disease is commonly known.

The people who suffer from it, celiacs, must eliminate from their diet all kinds of products that usually contain wheat: bread, pastries, beer .... and introduce in their diets recipes called gluten-free, which may be these same products but free of wheat.

People with celiac disease must follow their diet correctly with gluten-free recipes since not doing this correctly could lead to intestinal problems and longer-term serious health problems.

With the diets and menus for coeliacs collected in this application you can enjoy a wide range of recipes to fulfill correctly all the eating habits you must meet to maintain good health.

With the ingredients and homemade menus collected in it you can cook succulent dishes suitable for a gluten-free diet.

We collect homemade menus to cook with simple ingredients all of them suitable for coeliacs.

Our goal with this application is to follow some healthy eating habits with foods that you will find suitable for people with celiac disease.

Get a diet with homemade ingredients to cook for people who suffer from celiac disease.

Includes delicious menus to prepare.

The application is free and in it you will find pastry recipes, delicious gluten-free diets, baked recipes ... to cook quickly.

The best gluten-free recipes for you to find the right menu for your needs.

descriptionHTML:
Every day there are more cases of people who have an intolerance to wheat, that is, they are recognized as having celiac disease, which is how this disease is commonly known.

The people who suffer from it, celiacs, must eliminate from their diet all kinds of products that usually contain wheat: bread, pastries, beer .... and introduce in their diets recipes called gluten-free, which may be these same products but free of wheat.

People with celiac disease must follow their diet correctly with gluten-free recipes since not doing this correctly could lead to intestinal problems and longer-term serious health problems.

With the diets and menus for coeliacs collected in this application you can enjoy a wide range of recipes to fulfill correctly all the eating habits you must meet to maintain good health.

With the ingredients and homemade menus collected in it you can cook succulent dishes suitable for a gluten-free diet.

We collect homemade menus to cook with simple ingredients all of them suitable for coeliacs.

Our goal with this application is to follow some healthy eating habits with foods that you will find suitable for people with celiac disease.

Get a diet with homemade ingredients to cook for people who suffer from celiac disease.

Includes delicious menus to prepare.

The application is free and in it you will find pastry recipes, delicious gluten-free diets, baked recipes ... to cook quickly.

The best gluten-free recipes for you to find the right menu for your needs.

We put at your disposal the best dishes to share with this application.

You will find delicious dishes, the best breakfast, how to prepare fried gluten-free ... all thanks to the videos gathered here.

Get a healthy diet with the home ingredients suitable for coeliacs that we present in this application.

The application includes all kinds of recipes suitable for people with this disease.

The best and most delicious diets gathered for you in this application to make your illness easier thanks to the dishes you can cook.

title: Gluten Free Recipes
description:
A gluten-free diet (GFD) is a diet that excludes gluten, a protein composite found in wheat, barley, rye, and all their species and hybrids (such as spelt, kamut, and triticale). The inclusion of oats in gluten-free diet remains controversial.

title: Freezon: Gluten, lactose & other "free" places
description:
Freezon collects the World's restaurants and shops where people with allergies and intolerances or who follows special diets can find foods, drinks and goods for themselves.
Currently we list places with intolerances of gluten, dairy, egg or sugar and special diets for vegan, vegetarian or paleo.
Places found in the application are based on developers' collections and users send-ins and the list is continuously growing.
Users can also rate and review places in the Freezon app so they help each other to find worth-to-visit places. 
They can also suggest modifications for the places listed in the app.

Featured diets are:
- gluten free
- dairy free
- egg free
- sugar free
- vegan or vegetarian
- paleo

title: ShopWell - Better Food Choices
description:
Know your Food. Shopwell. 
 
The free Shopwell app simplifies nutrition labels and helps you discover new foods that fit your lifestyle. 
 
Shopwell provides personalized nutrition scores when you create a Food Profile with your dietary goals, health concerns, allergies and dislikes. Simply scan any item to see quick nutritional information and learn how it matches with your needs -- not an average. Discover products that are a better match for you. Create lists of your favorite finds and share them with family and friends. It‚Äôs that easy. 
 
Shopwell personalized results are a free, easy and fun way to discover the foods that are right for you.
 
 
Features:
 
‚Äî Barcode scanner translates nutritionals into quick, easy-to-digest information on more than 400,000 foods
‚ÄîPersonalized food recommendations.
‚Äî Location awareness to find products in your local grocery store.
‚Äî NEW! Create lists of your favorite foods and share them with your friends and family. Follow lists made by your friends and celebrity influencers
 
We help you stay on track by offering alerts and support for food allergies and food goals including:
 
Pregnancy
Gluten Free

recentChanges: Bug fixes & general improvements
comments: Best app I found for seeing if certain foods will aggravate my food sensitivities without having to scan every goddamned label and look everything up myself. Could stand to be fleshed out a bit more, but a great tool nonetheless.
This is a very addictive sites to look at ingredients but no longer possible to use it on browser unless you just browse by the category only but good to look at nutrition fact.

I began using this app when my doctor recommended I do the low fodmap diet for 6 weeks. I thought this would make shopping for specific foods a lot easier. Boy, was I wrong. It is not accurate when you scan items in the store. For example, I would scan items, and it would say to avoid this item because of a certain ingredient in it, like soy. I would then look at the ingredients on the product and nowhere would it be listed. I would not recommend this app.

So far so good! My only suggestion would be to add a filter menu to searches / scanned items / lists, which provides options for sorting by food groups, brands, descending/ascending number rating, and excellent, good, poor, etc. matches only. As it is, looking through lists and searches is a nightmare when you have a LOT of items to look through. Another helpful feature would be to add an option to filter out duplicate items in searches--I once had a search give me 10+ dupes for several items.

I was reluntant at first to try this app due to a lot of negative reviews and comments. I just found out some food allergies that is includes in lots of foods, such as wheat, and this app is a good help. It also helps with other ingredients you want to avoid, such as sugar, etc. It even shows you foods that will be good for you to choose that disclides everything, which is good for someone new to a bad allergy trying to find new foods to eat. So far, I love this app

title: Food Scanner ‚Äì free barcode scanner for nutrition
description:
Food Scanner is a simple barcode grocery scanner that lets you quickly discover a food's ingredient information. It's a useful essential if you care about the food you eat. And it's ideal for those with a particular sensitivity or allergy. Or for people with specific diets, such as vegan, vegetarian, gluten free, halal and kosher.

Grocery shopping can be tricky sometimes. If you have a particular diet, or you find yourself wondering is it gluten free? Or is it vegan? With this app you can simply scan or search by name to get detailed nutritional information in seconds.

Find out for certain if a food or drink is vegan. Or check if it's vegetarian, gluten free, halal, kosher or sugar free. Plus you can also check for allergens, e-additives, preservatives and the nutritional values of foods.

Install Food Scanner today, and you can de-clutter your phone of all those other scanning apps, as it's an all-in-one product scanner, offering a gluten scanner, halal scanner, vegan scanner, ingredients scanner and qr & barcode scanner.

Top features:
- Instant barcode scanning
- Scan using the built-in flashlight
- Easily search for products manually by simply entering the product name
- Scan an unlimited number of products
- Share the details of food products you scan
- Check the history of previously scanned food
- Get detailed information about a food's packaging
- Plus useful new updates coming soon

Terms of use: https://telegra.ph/Terms--Conditions-02-28
Privacy policy: https://telegra.ph/Privacy-Policy-02-28-12

developerAddress:
1321 N Las Palmas Ave
Los Angeles, CA 90028
recentChanges:
- Developed functionality for adding products that are not in the database and editing existing.
- Added new label logic for your preferences and allergens. Make contributions and receive visual points by answering clarification questions about the products that correlate with your food preferences and exceptions.
- Updated design for contribution labels for preferences and allergens. Now it's easy to see if the product label is approved, declined or under review.
comments: Downloaded because of high recommendations. App doesn't load and keeps telling me I'm not connected to the internet, even if I hardwire to my modem.

It scans well and comes back with results quickly, but it's not accurate. I scanned two well known absolutely vegan products and it came back as non vegan. It's a shame because the app has promise. Lost stars due to the accuracy of the results.

Don't waste your time. The first product I scanned was not recognised and you have to go through a process of scanning and providing the details yourself. Fine it helps others but since gluten is not apparently an allergen and is one of the most common it is clear they have not made any serious attempt.
Scanned 3 common items just to see how it works. No information on any of them, 1 was a nationally available loaf of bread. Don't waste your time.
Not working on Xiaomi Mi Mix 3

title: My Food Allergies Scanner
description:
A very handy app, to help all those who must follow a restricted diet due to food allergies or food intolerances.

People affected by one or more food allergies spend a lot of time on the shelves to find a product that they can consume safely!

By scanning the products, the application saves you a lot of time, helps you find allergens hidden behind additives or other, but also to decode ingredients in other languages!

Just scan the barcode of the product or enter it manually and it will tell you if you can or can‚Äôt consume it with the food allergies or intolerances you have.

The list of allergens:

‚úπ Gluten
‚úπ Milk
‚úπ Nuts
‚úπ Peanuts
‚úπ Eggs
‚úπ Soy
‚úπ Fish
‚úπ Crustaceans
‚úπ Celery
‚úπ Mustard
‚úπ Sesame seeds
‚úπ Lupine
‚úπ Molluscs
‚úπ  sulphur dioxide and sulphites
‚úπ Corn 
‚úπ buckwheat 

Other allergens will be coming according to the demand of the users, do not hesitate to contact us via e-mail :
Service.client.schak@gmail.com

Terms of use :
The algorithm of the app is based on the list of ingredients of each product, since the application uses an open source database (by everyone to everyone) that of OPEN FOOD FACTS, the data may sometimes be incomplete or wrong! the only official information remains the one on the physical packaging of the product.
The contents of this application are for information purposes only and do not represent medical diagnosis, treatment recommendations or medication. Although the information provided here has been compiled for the best knowledge of the author, errors occur, as this is a complex issue that depends on each individual. We assume no responsibility for the accuracy, completeness, balance and timeliness of the contents of the application, and disclaims any liability to the extent permitted by law. We assume no responsibility for acts that are or are not performed on the basis of the content of the app. Consequently, we are not liable for any direct or indirect damages, consequential damages or other obligations arising from the use of the contents of the application. 

The contents of the application do not in any way replace individual examination and advice by a medical specialist. In case of health problems, always consult a qualified specialist for an individual diagnosis and treatment.

title: Biteappy: Allergy Diet Eating
description:
‚ÄòBiteappy‚Äô is the app for people with dietary intolerances and allergies who want to search for and locate suitable eateries and restaurants in their area ‚Äì on a worldwide basis.

With such a large range of food allergies, intolerances and special dietary requirements across the world, it can be almost impossible for people to find a restaurant, eatery or bar to cater for their diet or allergy.

Whether you are a vegan with gluten intolerance or someone following a strict kosher diet that wants to avoid MSG, Biteappy will allow you to search for and find the restaurant you need to cater for your dietary needs in just a few taps!
No more searching the Internet and calling restaurants to make sure they cater for your special diet or food allergy.

ALL DIETARY ALLERGIES & INTOLERANCES

Biteappy is the first and only worldwide app to comprehensively address the entire plethora of dietary issues and allergies including gluten free for coeliac, dairy free if you are lactose intolerant, nut free, MSG free, preservative free and other more specific ingredient-free requirements, such as celery or mustard.

The app caters for all special dietary requirements including Vegan, Vegetarian, Paleo, Gluten Free Kosher and Halal.

Don‚Äôt worry if you suffer from multiple food allergies and intolerances our search engine will allow you to select as many as you like no matter what your special diet requirements are.

HOW IT WORKS

1) Login in with Facebook/ Google + or a simple email
2) Users select their specific dietary and cuisine criteria and then search for suitable restaurants in their vicinity, wherever they are in the world.
3) Bite happy with ‚ÄòBiteappy‚Äô

TRANSLATIONS

The app also offers simple translations in over 25 languages, so when abroad it can help users communicate their requirements more easily.

ADDED FEATURES

‚ÄòBiteappy‚Äô also offers a number of added features including:
- Saving your favourites with the click of a heart button
- Keep your preferred dietary preferences saved in Profile for nearby searches - Contribute to the ‚ÄòBiteappy‚Äô community by allowing users to add restaurants to the ‚ÄòBiteappy‚Äô database.
- Provide and share feedback and reviews on places visited for others to benefit from.
- Recipes: view an array of gluten free, dairy free, lactose free, vegan, vegetarian recipes and cook along with us.

Don‚Äôt forget to check out our website to use the service to find the right restaurant for your own specific diet through your browser at www.biteappy.com

Follow us on Twitter: @Biteappy
Like us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/biteappy

title: Gluten-Free Diet Recipes
description:
A gluten-free diet (GFD) is a diet that strictly excludes gluten, which is a mixture of proteins found in wheat (and all of its species and hybrids, such as spelt, kamut, and triticale), as well as barley, rye, and oats. The inclusion of oats in a gluten-free diet remains controversial, and may depend on the oat cultivar and the frequent cross-contamination with other gluten-containing cereals.

Gluten may cause both gastrointestinal and systemic symptoms for those with gluten-related disorders, including coeliac disease (CD), non-coeliac gluten sensitivity (NCGS), gluten ataxia, dermatitis herpetiformis (DH), and wheat allergy.In these people, the gluten-free diet is demonstrated as an effective treatment, but several studies show that about 79% of the people with coeliac disease have an incomplete recovery of the small bowel, despite a strict gluten-free diet. This is mainly caused by inadvertent ingestion of gluten.[10] People with poor basic education and understanding of gluten-free diet often believe that they are strictly following the diet, but are making regular errors.

In addition, a gluten-free diet may, in at least some cases, improve gastrointestinal or systemic symptoms in diseases like irritable bowel syndrome, rheumatoid arthritis, multiple sclerosis or HIV enteropathy, among others. Gluten-free diets have also been promoted as an alternative treatment of people with autism, but the current evidence for their efficacy in making any change in the symptoms of autism is limited and weak.

Gluten proteins have low nutritional and biological value, and the grains that contain gluten are not essential in the human diet. However, an unbalanced selection of food and an incorrect choice of gluten-free replacement products may lead to nutritional deficiencies. Replacing flour from wheat or other gluten-containing cereals with gluten-free flours in commercial products may lead to a lower intake of important nutrients, such as iron and B vitamins. Some gluten-free commercial replacement products are not enriched or fortified as their gluten-containing counterparts, and often have greater lipid/carbohydrate content. Children especially often over-consume these products, such as snacks and biscuits. Nutritional complications can be prevented by a correct dietary education.

A gluten-free diet should be mainly based on naturally gluten-free foods with a good balance of micro and macro nutrients: meat, fish, eggs, milk and dairy products, legumes, nuts, fruits, vegetables, potatoes, rice, and corn are all appropriate components of such a diet. If commercially prepared, gluten-free replacement products are used, choosing those that are enriched or fortified with vitamins and minerals is preferable. Pseudocereals (quinoa, amaranth, and buckwheat) and some minor cereals are healthy alternatives to these prepared products and have high biological and nutritional value. Furthermore, they contain protein of higher nutritional quality than those of wheat, and in greater quantities.

Feedback:-
If you have any suggested features or improvement, please leave a comment. In case something is not working correctly please let me know. When posting low rating please describe what is wrong to give the possibility to fix that issue.

Ads--
There are ads in this app. Images for this app are stored on the internet and this costs money. application is free, it does not promote paid version of this app, the only way to support future development is to include ads. Please treat that with understanding.

Download now for free, Enjoy and Good Luck...

title: Ask Ingrid
description:
You want to know if a food is compatible with fructose malabsorption, lactose, sorbitol or histamine intolerance? Or do you want to find out if it is gluten-free or suitable for irritable bowel syndrome (IBS)? Well, just ask Ingrid!‚Ä®‚Ä®Ingrid is your companion in everyday life with food intolerances. She gives you information about the tolerability, the amount of fructose, lactose, sorbitol, gluten, histamine or FODMAP in your food. 
‚Ä®Download the free app and adjust your personal intolerances. Ingrid shows you all the important information. The information is based on scientific findings and the food ratings are developed in collaboration with the experts of the Austrian charity ‚ÄúSociety for Public Health‚Äù. Ingrid also shows you how well individual foods are tolerated by other people. So the community results let you see, how other patients tolerated that foods.‚Ä®‚Ä®***‚Ä®Scientific data‚Ä®***‚Ä®The data come from the ‚ÄúSociety for Public Health‚Äù. This project has been researching intolerance for many years and has created the basis for Ingrid with a special food intolerance database. The data used are all derived from scientific research, evaluated by patients and tested by nutrition experts.‚Ä®‚Ä®***‚Ä®Community rating: Patients rate compatibility‚Ä®***‚Ä®But Ingrid has a very special feature: Every user can document his/her personal tolerance of certain foods. These data are evaluated anonymously by Ingrid and made available to all other users. You see not only the scientific nutritional data, but also the evaluation of thousands of other stakeholders. These two independent evaluation criteria allow you to make your perfect individual diet and finally enjoy your life again without discomfort.‚Ä®‚Ä®***‚Ä®Only compatible foods‚Ä®***‚Ä®Ingrid will also automatically show you an individualized list of foods that are tolerable. Because Ingrid is not about prohibitions, but about a better lifestyle. And that includes a balanced diet.‚Ä®‚Ä®***‚Ä®Free and ad-free version‚Ä®***‚Ä®Ingrid is free but shows ads. If that bothers you, you can make Ingrid ad-free with an in-app purchase. This small annual contribution helps promote Ingrid's development. If you choose to buy ‚ÄúAsk Ingrid‚Äù, you will be charged an annual fee via your Google Play account. For more information, please read our Privacy Policy and Terms of Use. (Http://frag-ingrid.com/datenschutz/).
‚Ä®***‚Ä®If you have any questions, requests or suggestions, please send us an e-mail to ingrid@frag-ingrid.com. If you like Ingrid, we look forward to a positive ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ rating.

title: Gluten Detector
description:
Gluten Detector is an application to facilitate the identification of the substance right from the
product label. Sometimes it is hard to know if that product can be safely used. Do you want to 
know if there is hidden source of gluten in the composition of food, cosmetic or medicine? 
Just click on the screen of your smartphone or tablet and you will discover quickly. Gluten 
Detector is ideal to help people with allergies, sensitivity, which have dietary restrictions or 
who simply adhere a gluten-free diet.

This application is for information only and detects whether or not the presence of the 
substance gluten in the product from the information provided by the manufacturer, listed on 
the label of ingredients/composition. So found, the Application shows the message Gluten 
Detected!, stating the origin: wheat, oat (possible contamination), barley, malt, rye.

Gluten Detector works like this:

Step 1. Check on the product label that indicates ingredients/composition.

Step 2. Enter the name of the substance you want to know about, for example :

            Wheat Flour

Step 3. Complete the search and done! Gluten Detected!

Now it's easy to choose what to use in your life!

And Gluten detector is just beginning. New features are coming soon.

We appreciate suggestions and please, if you find errors or have any questions, contact us!

title: Celiac recipes to take care of your health
description:
We live in a society that is increasingly intolerant of certain foods.

This happens with celiacs, they are intolerant to wheat. It is an intolerance that can lead to something more serious that is why I bring this application, to raise awareness.

They are healthy recipes, homemade, gluten-free, suitable for celiacs. They are not just recipes of dishes to cook, you will also learn pastries for the whole family, without clear gluten.

Learn another formula for baking bread, healthy homemade recipes not only for coeliacs, because the ingredients for coeliacs can be taken by other people. Unfortunately, not the other way around.

Learn to make empanadas, pizzas, churros. Be one of those chefs who can make any dish.

Make homemade diets for coeliacs, with homemade ingredients without wheat, corn flour for baking, or rice for frying. They are ingredients of all kinds that we show you in this application, healthy and natural foods, free of wheat, to cook with friends or family. Homemade gluten-free breads, suitable for celiacs and non-celiacs.

In this application we show you the best pastry videos for celiacs, all diets, suitable for cooking anyone without being an expert cook. Homemade and easy videos, with healthy foods.

Prepare a good breakfast free. These recipes are available to you for all the diets of a celiac, without forgetting the pastry. Fried kitchen for the family, a perfect breakfast.

With this application you will receive detailed advice on diets with ingredients for celiacs and also for the whole family.

title: Gluten Free Today
description:
Para personas quien tienen desordenes relacionados al gluten [enfermedad celiaca (EC), sensibilidad al gluten no-celiaca, o dermatitis herpetiforme, lo cual es una manifestaci√≥n en la piel de la EC], es necesario evitar el gluten para razones de salud. Gluten es el nombre gen√©rico para ciertos tipos de prote√≠nas que se encuentran en los granos trigo, cebada, centeno, y sus derivados. Cuando una persona con enfermedad celiaca ingiere gluten, ocurre una reacci√≥n inmune, lo cual da√±a el intestino delgado y puede causar s√≠ntomas y problemas de salud en casi cualquier parte del cuerpo. A√∫n cantidades muy peque√±as de gluten pueden causar problemas, independiente de que hay s√≠ntomas obvios o no. En cuanto a la sensibilidad al gluten no-celiaca, esta es una condici√≥n que todav√≠a no est√° bien entendida, pero parece que el consumo de gluten no causa el mismo tipo de da√±o al intestino como es el caso en la enfermedad celiaca. Sin embargo, es tambi√©n necesario eliminar el gluten de la dieta, ya que su consumo tiene diversos efectos adversos en la salud.

Los siguientes granos, tal como derivados e h√≠bridos de estos granos tienen que ser eliminados de la dieta:
Trigo ‚Äì incluye variedades como: duro, espelta, emmer, s√©mola, farro, y einkorn.
Cebada
Centeno
Escoge granos y harinas que son naturalmente sin-gluten, incluyendo arroz, ma√≠z, soya, papa, tapioca, sorgo, quinua, mijo, trigo sarraceno, yuca, arrurruz, coco, tef, lino, ch√≠a y harinas de frijoles y nueces.
Investigaciones cient√≠ficas indican que avena pura y no contaminada con gluten consumida en cantidades moderadas (hasta ¬Ω taza de avena seca por dia), es tolerada por la mayor√≠a de las personas con enfermedad celiaca. Escoge avena no contaminada que es certificada sin gluten, y consulte con su m√©dico o dietista antes de incluir la avena en su dieta.
Otros alimentos que naturalmente no contienen gluten son frutas y verduras; carnes frescas, aves, y pescado; frijoles y lentejas, nueces y semillas; y productos l√°cteos sencillos. Estos alimentos en sus formas puras no contienen gluten. Versiones procesados o con sabores agregados pueden contener ingredientes con gluten.
Existen sustitutos sin gluten para alimentos que com√∫nmente son hechos de trigo, y son ampliamente disponibles en supermercados, tiendas de alimentos naturales, directamente de los fabricantes, y de sitios en el internet.
Bebidas alcoh√≥licas destiladas, vinagres destilados, y vino son seguros para incluir en la dieta sin gluten. La mayor√≠a de las cervezas, cerveza Inglesa y bebidas malteadas son hechos a base de granos que contienen gluten y NO son sin-gluten. Cervezas hechas de granos sin-gluten, como el sorgo, son sin-gluten.
 

Etiquetado de Alimentos: Como determinar si un producto es libre de gluten
Para seguir una dieta sin gluten con √©xito, es muy importante leer las etiquetas de alimentos procesadas cuidadosamente. Esto incluye afirmaciones de ‚Äúgluten-free‚Äù en los paquetes, tal como listados de ingredientes. Ya que los ingredientes se pueden cambiar en cualquier momento, es importante leer las etiquetas cada vez que haga sus compras.

Una clave para entender la dieta libre del gluten es poder convertirse en un buen lector de etiquetas de alimentos. Esto incluye tanto afirmaciones de ‚Äúsin-gluten,‚Äù igual como listados de ingredientes.
descriptionHTML:
Para personas quien tienen desordenes relacionados al gluten [enfermedad celiaca (EC), sensibilidad al gluten no-celiaca, o dermatitis herpetiforme, lo cual es una manifestaci√≥n en la piel de la EC], es necesario evitar el gluten para razones de salud. Gluten es el nombre gen√©rico para ciertos tipos de prote√≠nas que se encuentran en los granos trigo, cebada, centeno, y sus derivados. Cuando una persona con enfermedad celiaca ingiere gluten, ocurre una reacci√≥n inmune, lo cual da√±a el intestino delgado y puede causar s√≠ntomas y problemas de salud en casi cualquier parte del cuerpo. A√∫n cantidades muy peque√±as de gluten pueden causar problemas, independiente de que hay s√≠ntomas obvios o no. En cuanto a la sensibilidad al gluten no-celiaca, esta es una condici√≥n que todav√≠a no est√° bien entendida, pero parece que el consumo de gluten no causa el mismo tipo de da√±o al intestino como es el caso en la enfermedad celiaca. Sin embargo, es tambi√©n necesario eliminar el gluten de la dieta, ya que su consumo tiene diversos efectos adversos en la salud.

Los siguientes granos, tal como derivados e h√≠bridos de estos granos tienen que ser eliminados de la dieta:
Trigo ‚Äì incluye variedades como: duro, espelta, emmer, s√©mola, farro, y einkorn.
Cebada
Centeno
Escoge granos y harinas que son naturalmente sin-gluten, incluyendo arroz, ma√≠z, soya, papa, tapioca, sorgo, quinua, mijo, trigo sarraceno, yuca, arrurruz, coco, tef, lino, ch√≠a y harinas de frijoles y nueces.
Investigaciones cient√≠ficas indican que avena pura y no contaminada con gluten consumida en cantidades moderadas (hasta ¬Ω taza de avena seca por dia), es tolerada por la mayor√≠a de las personas con enfermedad celiaca. Escoge avena no contaminada que es certificada sin gluten, y consulte con su m√©dico o dietista antes de incluir la avena en su dieta.
Otros alimentos que naturalmente no contienen gluten son frutas y verduras; carnes frescas, aves, y pescado; frijoles y lentejas, nueces y semillas; y productos l√°cteos sencillos. Estos alimentos en sus formas puras no contienen gluten. Versiones procesados o con sabores agregados pueden contener ingredientes con gluten.
Existen sustitutos sin gluten para alimentos que com√∫nmente son hechos de trigo, y son ampliamente disponibles en supermercados, tiendas de alimentos naturales, directamente de los fabricantes, y de sitios en el internet.
Bebidas alcoh√≥licas destiladas, vinagres destilados, y vino son seguros para incluir en la dieta sin gluten. La mayor√≠a de las cervezas, cerveza Inglesa y bebidas malteadas son hechos a base de granos que contienen gluten y NO son sin-gluten. Cervezas hechas de granos sin-gluten, como el sorgo, son sin-gluten.


Etiquetado de Alimentos: Como determinar si un producto es libre de gluten
Para seguir una dieta sin gluten con √©xito, es muy importante leer las etiquetas de alimentos procesadas cuidadosamente. Esto incluye afirmaciones de ‚Äúgluten-free‚Äù en los paquetes, tal como listados de ingredientes. Ya que los ingredientes se pueden cambiar en cualquier momento, es importante leer las etiquetas cada vez que haga sus compras.

Una clave para entender la dieta libre del gluten es poder convertirse en un buen lector de etiquetas de alimentos. Esto incluye tanto afirmaciones de ‚Äúsin-gluten,‚Äù igual como listados de ingredientes.

title: CodeCheck: Food & Cosmetic Product Scanner
description:
CodeCheck is your personal shopping assistant when it comes to healthy and conscious consumption üïµÔ∏è‚Äç-. Simply scan the barcode or EAN number of your food ü•ó or cosmetics üíÑ and in just a few seconds you can find out whether the products are vegan, vegetarian or gluten- or lactose-free. Additionally, if they contain: palm oil, microbeads, nanoparticles, parabens, paraffins, too much sugar, etc.. CodeCheck also helps you, if you have an allergy to something. Now you can also customize CodeCheck to fit you best. Based on your individual needs, it will give you a personal rating circle which shows whether a product is suitable for you. You can set warnings, for gluten or if a product is vegan or vegetarian or not ‚ö†Ô∏è. You will always receive suggestions of better alternatives, too. But CodeCheck isn‚Äôt just a product scanner and a smart shopping assistant. It‚Äôs also a wiki and a news feed ‚Äì all in one app üí™!

HOW IT WORKS
Download the free app or subscribe to the ad-free premium version 
Login and select one of four profiles or build your own. 
Further customize your profile based on your own lifestyle and diet to receive personalized ratings and alerts for example a vegan-, vegetarian- or gluten-alert.
Use the scanner and with a glance, find out if a product is suitable for you.
After scanning, simply scroll down to be shown more suitable alternatives. 
Stay up to date with the latest news on healthy and sustainable consumption
Live more healthily, sustainably, consciously and happily üëç.

INDEPENDENT RATINGS
We follow the latest scientific findings or independent expert opinions from organizations such as Greenpeace, BUND (Friends of the Earth Germany), the WWF, the Food Standards Agency, and consumer protection bodies like Verbraucherzentrale Hamburg, Verbraucher Initiative e.V. and Stiftung f√ºr Konsumentenschutz. The sources referenced for ratings are always listed under each ingredient.

WIKI 
Is your product not listed? Then why not become an active member of our CodeCheck community and enter products and all their ingredients into our database? Our algorithm will then immediately link these to the corresponding ratings by relevant experts.

NEWS FEED
Our news feed will show you all the relevant information besides offering fantastic tips, vegan or gluten-free recipes üë®‚Äçüç≥  and much more.

Ad-free Version
You can buy an ad-free version of CodeCheck.  If you decide to purchase CodeCheck ad-free, it will be done through your Play-Store account. 

If you have any questions, requests or suggestions, please write us at support@codecheck.info!

Do you like CodeCheck? If so, we welcome a positive ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ rating! We hope you have a great time shopping in a healthy, sustainable way.

Your CodeCheck Team

----------

Codecheck.info website

CODECHECK ON SOCIAL MEDIA
Facebook:	https://www.facebook.com/codecheck.info.de
Instagram:	https://www.instagram.com/codecheck_info/
Twitter:	https://twitter.com/codecheck_info
Pinterest:	https://www.pinterest.com/codecheckinfo
